ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK

block.text: MAK

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 1
The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

block.text: Dispela em i gutnius bilong Jisas Krais, Pikinini Bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As it is written in the prophets,

block.text: Dispela gutnius em i kamap pastaim olsem profet Aisaia i bin raitim,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.

block.text: "Harim. Bai mi salim wanpela man bilong autim tok bilong mi, na em i go paslain long yu. Na em bai i redim rot bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight!’”

block.text: Long ples i no gat man, maus bilong wanpela man i singaut olsem, 'Redim rot bilong Bikpela. Stretim ol rot bilong en.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: John came preaching in the wilderness, saying:

block.text: Jon, dispela man bilong givim baptais, em i kamap long ples i no gat man, na em i autim tok long ol manmeri

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent and be baptized for the forgiveness of sins.”

block.text: i mas tanim bel na kisim baptais, na bai God i tekewe sin bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the country of Judea and all those of Jerusalem went out to him. They were baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

block.text: Na olgeta Judia na olgeta manmeri bilong Jerusalem ol i go long Jon. Na ol i autim sin bilong ol, na Jon i baptaisim ol long wara Jordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John was clothed with camel's hair and a leather belt around his waist. He ate locusts and wild honey.
He preached, saying,

block.text: Jon i save putim klos ol i wokim long gras bilong kamel, na em i save pasim let long bel bilong en. Na em i save kaikai ol grasopa wantaim hani bilong bus.
Em i autim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and loosen.

block.text: "Wanpela man i kam bihain long mi, na strong bilong en i winim strong bilong mi. Mi no gutpela man inap long mi brukim skru na lusim string i pasim su bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I baptized you in water, but he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.”

block.text: Mi save baptaisim yupela long wara. Tasol em bai i baptaisim yupela long Holi Spirit."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas i lusim taun Nasaret long distrik Galili na i kam. Na Jon i baptaisim em long wara Jordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately coming up from the water, he saw the heavens parting, and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

block.text: Na Jisas i lusim wara na i kam antap, na wantu em i lukim heven i op, na Holi Spirit i kam daun long em olsem wanpela bilong ol dispela pisin ol i kolim balus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came out of the sky,

block.text: Na long heven wanpela maus i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini bilong mi. Mi laikim yu tumas. Bel bilong mi em i amamas long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness.

block.text: Na long dispela taim stret Holi Spirit i salim Jisas i go long ples i no gat man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was there in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals; and the angels were serving him.

block.text: Na Jisas i stap long ples i no gat man inap long 40 de, na Satan i traim em. Em i stap wantaim ol wel abus. Na ol ensel i helpim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now after John was taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom of God,
and saying,

block.text: Taim ol i kalabusim Jon pinis, Jisas i kam kamap long distrik Galili na i wok long autim gutnius bilong God.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The time is fulfilled, and the Kingdom of God is at hand! Repent, and believe in the Good News.”

block.text: "Taim God i makim em i kamap pinis, na Kingdom bilong God em i kam klostu pinis. Yupela i mas tanim bel na bilip long gutnius."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net into the sea, for they were fishermen.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jisas i wokabaut arere long raunwara Galili, na em i lukim Saimon wantaim brata bilong en Andru. Tupela i wok long tromoi umben long raunwara. Tupela i save wok bisnis long kisim pis.
Na Jisas i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come after me, and I will make you into fishers for men.”

block.text: "Yutupela kam bihainim mi, na bai mi lainim yutupela long pasin bilong kisim ol manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

block.text: Na kwiktaim tupela i lusim umben na i go bihainim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Going on a little further from there, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.

block.text: Jisas i wokabaut i go moa liklik, na em i lukim Jems, pikinini bilong Sebedi, wantaim brata bilong en Jon. Ol umben bilong tupela i bruk na tupela i stap long bot na i wok long stretim umben.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he called them, and they left their father, Zebedee, in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.

block.text: Na em i singautim tupela, na tupela i lusim papa Sebedi i stap long bot wantaim ol wokman, na tupela i go bihainim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol arapela man ol i go long taun Kaperneam. Na long taim de Sabat i kamap em i go insait long haus lotu na em i autim tok long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were astonished at his teaching, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.

block.text: Ol i harim tok bilong em, na ol i kirap nogut tru, long wanem, em i no skulim ol olsem ol saveman bilong lo i save mekim. Nogat. Em i skulim ol olsem man i gat namba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,
saying,

block.text: Long dispela taim wanpela man i stap long haus lotu bilong ol, na wanpela spirit nogut i stap long em. Orait dispela man i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ha! What do we have to do with you, Jesus, you Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know you who you are: the Holy One of God!”

block.text: "Jisas bilong Nasaret, yu kam bilong mekim wanem long mipela? Ating yu kam bilong bagarapim mipela? Mi save long yu. Yu dispela gutpela stretpela man i kam long God yet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus rebuked him, saying,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i krosim dispela spirit nogut na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet, and come out of him!”

block.text: "Yu pasim maus na yu lusim dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirit, convulsing him and crying with
a loud voice, came out of him.

block.text: Na spirit nogut i sakim dispela man, na i singaut bikmaus tru,
na i lusim dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying,

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i kirap nogut, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is this? A new teaching? For with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him!”

block.text: "Wanem samting i kamap nau? Dispela man i autim wanpela nupela tok, na em i autim tok olsem man i gat namba. Na taim em i givim tok long ol spirit nogut, ol i save harim tok bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report of him went out immediately everywhere into all the region of Galilee and its surrounding area.

block.text: Na kwiktaim stori bilong ol samting Jisas i mekim i raun long olgeta hap bilong Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, when they had come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol arapela man i lusim haus lotu na i go ausait, na ol i go stret long haus bilong Saimon tupela Andru. Na Jems na Jon i go wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Simon's wife's mother lay sick with a fever, and immediately they told him about her.

block.text: Mama bilong meri bilong Saimon i slip i stap long bet, long wanem, em i gat sik na skin bilong en i hat. Na kwiktaim ol i tokim Jisas long em i sik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and took her by the hand, and raised her up. The fever immediately left her, and she served them.

block.text: Na Jisas i go long em, na i holim han bilong en na i kirapim em. Na sik i lusim dispela meri, na em i redim kaikai bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to him all who were sick, and those who were possessed by demons.

block.text: Long taim san i go daun long apinun, na ol i bringim ol sikman i kam long Jisas. Na ol i bringim tu ol manmeri i gat spirit nogut i stap long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the city was gathered together at the door.

block.text: Olgeta manmeri bilong dispela taun ol i kam bung i stap klostu long dua bilong haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons. He didn't allow the demons to speak, because they knew him.

block.text: Orait Jisas i mekim orait planti manmeri i gat kain kain sik. Na em i rausim planti spirit nogut. Ol spirit nogut ol i save long em, olsem na em i tambuim ol long ol i no ken toktok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Early in the morning, while it was still dark, he rose up and went out, and departed into a deserted place and prayed there.

block.text: Long moningtaim tru Jisas i kirap na i go ausait na em i go long wanpela hap i no gat man, na em i prea i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon and those who were with him went to look for him.

block.text: Na bihain Saimon wantaim ol wantok bilong en ol i go painim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they found him they said,

block.text: Ol i lukim em pinis na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Everyone is looking for you.”

block.text: "Olgeta manmeri i wok long painim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because I came out for this reason.”

block.text: "Maski, yumi go long ol arapela taun i stap klostu. Mi laik autim tok long ol tu, long wanem, em dispela wok tasol mi kam bilong mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.

block.text: Na em i raun i go long olgeta hap bilong Galili, na em i autim tok insait long ol haus lotu bilong ol, na em i rausim ol spirit nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A leper came to him, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him,

block.text: Wanpela man i gat sik lepra i kam long Jisas na i askim em strong. Dispela man i brukim skru na i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you want to, you can make me clean.”

block.text: "Sapos yu laik, yu inap long mekim mi i kamap klin long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being moved with compassion, he stretched out his hand, and touched him, and said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i sori tru long em, na i putim han long em, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to… Be made clean.”

block.text: "Mi laik. Yu kamap klin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cured.

block.text: Orait wantu sik lepra i lusim dispela man, na em i kamap klin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent him away at once and warned him strictly,
saying:

block.text: Na Jisas i salim em i go hariap, na i tok strong long em
olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”

block.text: "Lukaut gut. Yu no ken tokim wanpela man long dispela samting i bin kamap long yu. Nogat. Yu go soim skin bilong yu long pris, na mekim ofa bilong soim olsem skin bilong yu i kamap klin pinis, olsem Moses i bin tok. Na bai ol man i ken save, sik bilong yu i pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he went out, and began to proclaim it much, and to spread about the matter, so that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was outside in desert places: and they came to him from everywhere.

block.text: Tasol dispela man i go, na em i tokim ol manmeri long olgeta dispela samting i bin kamap long em. Em i autim dispela stori long olgeta hap. Olsem na Jisas i no inap i go moa insait long wanpela taun long ai bilong ol manmeri. Nogat. Em i stap ausait tasol, long ol hap i no gat man. Na ol manmeri bilong olgeta hap ol i kam long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 2
When he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was heard that he was in the house.

block.text: Sampela de i go pinis, na Jisas i go long taun Kaperneam gen. Na ol manmeri i harim tok long em i stap long haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately many were gathered together, so that there was no more room, not even around the door; and he spoke the word to them.

block.text: Na planti manmeri i kam bung, na haus i pulap tru. Na klostu long dua tu i no gat hap ples i stap nating. Na Jisas i wok long autim tok long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Four people came, carrying a paralytic to him.

block.text: Na ol i bringim wanpela sikman i kam long em. Bun bilong dispela man i dai olgeta. Na 4 -pela man i karim dispela sikman i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

block.text: Ples i pas tru, na ol i no inap bringim sikman i kam klostu long Jisas. Olsem na ol i karim sikman i go antap long rup bilong dispela haus Jisas i stap long en. Na ol i rausim hap bilong rup, na ol i slekim bet sikman i slip long en i go daun insait long haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic,

block.text: Jisas i lukim olsem ol i bilip tru, na em i tokim dispela sikman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”

block.text: "Pikinini, mi lusim pinis ol sin bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

block.text: Sampela saveman bilong lo i sindaun i stap long haus, na long bel bilong ol ol i tingting olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does this man speak blasphemies like that? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na dispela man i mekim dispela kain tok? Em i laik kisim ples bilong God. I no gat wanpela man em inap long lusim sin. Em i wok bilong God wanpela tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, said to them,

block.text: Na wantu Jisas i save pinis long bel bilong en long dispela tingting bilong ol. Na em i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason these things in your hearts?

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i gat dispela kain tingting long bel bilong yupela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?’

block.text: Wanem tok em i isi long mi mekim long dispela man? Em i isi long mi tok, 'Mi lusim ol sin bilong yu,' o em i isi long mi tok, 'Yu kirap na kisim bet bilong yu na wokabaut'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins,”

block.text: Tasol mi laik bai yupela i save olsem, Pikinini Bilong Man em i gat strong long dispela graun, na em inap long lusim ol sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: --he said to the paralytic—

block.text: Orait na Jisas i lukluk i go long dispela man bun bilong en i dai olgeta, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.”

block.text: "Mi tokim yu, yu kirap na kisim bet bilong yu, na yu go long haus bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose, and immediately took up the mat, and went out in front of them all; so that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying,

block.text: Na dispela man i kirap na long ai bilong olgeta manmeri em i kisim bet bilong en kwiktaim na i wokabaut i go. Na olgeta manmeri I kirap nogut tru, na ol i litimapim nem bilong God, na ol i tok,

block.characterId: everyone who saw healing of paralytic

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: everyone who saw healing of paralytic
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We never saw anything like this!”

block.text: "Bipo mipela i no lukim kain samting olsem. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out again by the seaside. All the multitude came to him, and he taught them.

block.text: Orait Jisas i wokabaut i go gen long nambis bilong raunwara Galili. Na bikpela lain manmeri i kam long em, na em i givim tok bilong God long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he passed by, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax office, and he said to him,

block.text: Na em i wokabaut i go, na em i lukim Livai, pikinini bilong Alfius, i sindaun i stap long haus takis. Na Jisas I tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: "Yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And he arose and followed him.

block.text: Na Livai i kirap i go bihainim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

block.text: Jisas i sindaun kaikai long haus bilong Livai. Na planti man bilong kisim takis na planti man bilong mekim sin, ol i sindaun kaikai wantaim Jisas na ol disaipel bilong en. I gat planti bilong dispela kain man i save bihainim Jisas oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes and the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples,

block.text: Na sampela saveman bilong lo, ol i man bilong lain Farisi, ol i lukim Jisas i kaikai wantaim ol dispela man bilong mekim sin na ol man bilong kisim takis. Na ol i askim ol disaipel bilong Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why is it that he eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”

block.text: "Watpo em i save kaikai wantaim ol man bilong kisim takis na ol man bilong mekim sin?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them,

block.text: Jisas I harim dispela tok, na em i tokim ol dispela saveman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick. I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

block.text: "Ol man i no gat sik ol i no save go long dokta. Nogat. Ol sikman tasol i save go long dokta. Olsem tasol, mi no kam bilong singautim ol stretpela man. Nogat. Mi kam bilong singautim ol man i save mekim sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting, and they came and asked him,

block.text: Wanpela taim ol disaipel bilong Jon na ol Farisi tu ol I tambu long kaikai. Na sampela man i kam askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples don't fast?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na ol disaipel bilong Jon na ol disaipel bilong ol Farisi ol i save tambu long kaikai, tasol ol disaipel bilong yu i no save tambu long kaikai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can't fast.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i laik marit, ating ol wantok bilong en inap tambu long kaikai long taim em i stap yet wantaim ol? Nogat. Taim dispela man i laik marit em i stap yet wantaim ol, ol i no inap tambu long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

block.text: Tasol bihain, taim ol i kisim dispela man i go pinis na em i no moa i stap wantaim ol wantok bilong en, orait long dispela taim ol bai i tambu long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment, or else the patch shrinks and the new tears away from the old, and a worse hole is made.

block.text: "I no gat man i save kisim hap nupela laplap bilong samapim hul long olpela saket. Sapos em i mekim olsem, orait taim ol i wasim saket dispela laplap bilong pasim hul em bai i go liklik na brukim saket gen. Nupela bai i brukim olpela, na hul bai i kamap bikpela moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and the wine pours out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into fresh wineskins.”

block.text: Na i no gat man i save pulimapim nupela wain long olpela skin meme. Sapos em i mekim olsem, orait wain bai i brukim skin meme, na wain na skin meme bai i lus wantaim. Nogat. Ol i save pulimapim nupela wain long ol nupela skin meme."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that he was going on the Sabbath day through the grain fields, and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of grain.
The Pharisees said to him,

block.text: Long wanpela de Sabat Jisas I wokabaut namel long ol gaden wit. Na ol disaipel bilong en ol I wokabaut wantaim em, na ol i kisim sampela kaikai bilong wit.
Na ol Farisi i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, why do they do that which is not lawful on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: "Harim. Watpo ol i mekim dispela pasin I tambu long mekim long de Sabat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Did you never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry--he, and those who were with him?

block.text: "Ating yupela i no bin ritim dispela stori long samting Devit i bin mekim bipo? Mi tok long dispela taim em wantaim ol lain bilong en ol i sot long kaikai na ol i hangre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the days when Abiathar was high priest, David entered into God's house and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for the priests to eat. He also gave some to those who were with him?”

block.text: Abiatar i stap hetpris, na Devit i go insait long haus bilong God, na em i kaikai dispela bret ol i save putim i stap long pes bilong God. Dispela bret i tambu, na ol pris tasol inap long kaikai. Tasol Devit em i kaikai, na em i givim long ol lain bilong en tu. Yupela i no bin ritim dispela tok, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

block.text: "God i no putim ol manmeri bilong helpim de Sabat. Nogat. Em i putim de Sabat bilong helpim ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

block.text: Olsem na Pikinini Bilong Man em i bosim de Sabat tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 3
He entered again into the synagogue, and there was a man there who had his hand withered.

block.text: Jisas i go insait long haus lotu gen. Na wanpela man i stap, wanpela han bilong en i dai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They watched him to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath day, so that they might accuse him.

block.text: Na ol man i was gut long Jisas, long wanem, ol i laik save, em bai i mekim orait dispela man long de Sabat, o nogat. Ol i ting, sapos Jisas i mekim dispela kain pasin, ol bai i kotim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the man who had the withered hand,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim dispela man, han bilong en i nogut, olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stand up.”

block.text: "Yu kam hia."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful on the Sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? To save a life, or to kill?”

block.text: "Ating yumi ken mekim gutpela pasin long de Sabat, o yumi ken mekim pasin nogut? Ating yumi ken helpim ol man na mekim ol i stap gut, o yumi ken kilim ol i dai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent.

block.text: Tasol ol man i no bekim wanpela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk raun long ol, na em i belhat. Em i lukim bel bilong ol i pas, na em i bel hevi long dispela. Na em i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: "Stretim han bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

block.text: Orait em i stretim han, na han i kamap gutpela gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

block.text: Na kwiktaim ol Farisi i kirap na lusim haus na i go, na ol i bung wantaim lain bilong Herot. Ol i wokim toktok bilong painim rot long kilim Jisas i dai. em

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with his disciples, and a great multitude followed him from Galilee, from Judea,

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i lusim dispela ples na ol i go long raunwara Galili. Na bikpela lain manmeri i bihainim em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: from Jerusalem, from Idumaea, beyond the Jordan, and those from around Tyre and Sidon. A great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came to him.

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong distrik Galili na bilong distrik Judia na bilong taun Jerusalem na bilong distrik Idumea na bilong graun i stap long hapsait bilong wara Jordan na bilong hap bilong taun Tair na Saidon, ol i harim tok long ol samting Jisas i mekim, na bikpela lain manmeri tru i kam long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to his disciples that a little boat should stay near him because of the crowd, so that they wouldn't press on him.

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem, "Bikpela lain manmeri moa i stap. Nogut ol i pas long mi na subim mi strong. Bringim wanpela bot i kam sambai, na sapos ol manmeri i pas tru, mi ken kalap long bot."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he had healed many, so that as many as had diseases pressed on him that they might touch him.

block.text: Bipo Jisas i bin mekim orait planti manmeri, olsem na ol manmeri i gat sik ol i laik putim han long em, na ol i wok long subim ol arapela bai ol yet i ken i go klostu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him, and cried,

block.text: Na taim ol spirit nogut i lukim em, ol i save brukim skru long em na singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Son of God!”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sternly warned them, saying:

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save tambuim ol strong long ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not make my presence known.”

block.text: i no ken tokaut ples klia long em yet em i husat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went up into the mountain, and called to himself those whom he wanted, and they went to him.

block.text: Jisas i go antap long maunten. Em i laik makim sampela man long stap wantaim em. Na em i singautim ol dispela man, na ol i kam long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them out to preach,
and to have authority to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons:

block.text: Na em i makim 12 -pela man, bai ol i stap wantaim em, na em i givim nem aposel long ol. Em i laik salim ol i go bilong autim tok bilong God,
na em i laik givim strong long ol bilong rausim ol spirit nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon, to whom he gave the name Peter;

block.text: Em i makim 12 -pela. Wanpela em Saimon, na Jisas i givim narapela nem Pita long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: James the son of Zebedee; John, the brother of James, and he surnamed them Boanerges, which means, Sons of Thunder;

block.text: Na em i makim tu Jems, pikinini bilong Sebedi, wantaim brata bilong en Jon. Na em i kolim tupela long nem Boanerges. Mining bilong dispela nem i olsem, "Ol man i olsem klaut i pairap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Andrew; Philip; Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Zealot;

block.text: Na em i makim tu Andru na Filip na Bartolomyu na Matyu na Tomas na Jems, em pikinini bilong Alfius, na Tadius na Saimon, em wanpela man bilong lain Selot,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. He came into a house.

block.text: na Judas Iskariot, em dispela man bihain em i givim Jisas long han bilong ol man i laik mekim nogut long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.

block.text: Jisas i go long haus. Na ol bikpela lain manmeri i kam bung gen, olsem na Jisas wantaim ol disaipel ol i no gat taim bilong kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said,

block.text: Ol wanblut bilong Jisas i harim tok long ol samting Jisas i mekim, na ol i kam bilong kisim em. Ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is insane.”

block.text: "Em i longlong pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem said,

block.text: Sampela saveman bilong lo i stap long Jerusalem ol i kam daun, na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has Beelzebul,”

block.text: "Belsebul i stap long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and,
“By the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.”

block.text: Em i save rausim ol spirit nogut long strong bilong Belsebul tasol, em hetman bilong ol spirit nogut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He summoned them, and said to them in parables,

block.text: Na Jisas i singautim ol i kam klostu long em, na em i mekim sampela tok piksa long ol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How can Satan cast out Satan?

block.text: "Olsem wanem na Satan inap rausim Satan?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

block.text: Sapos ol man bilong wanpela kantri i bruk tupela lain na ol i pait, dispela kantri bai i no inap i stap strong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

block.text: Na sapos ol man bilong wanpela haus ol i bruk tupela lain na ol i pait, dispela haus i no inap i stap strong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can't stand, but has an end.

block.text: Na sapos Satan i birua long em yet na lain bilong en i bruk, orait em i no inap i stap strong. Nogat. Em bai i pinis olgeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.

block.text: "I no gat man inap i go insait long haus bilong wanpela strongpela man na kisim nating ol samting bilong en. Nogat. Em i mas pasim dispela strongpela man long baklain pastaim. Sapos em i mekim olsem, orait nau bai em inap kisim ol samting i stap long haus bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, all the sins and blasphemies of men will be forgiven.

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela olsem, God bai i lusim olgeta sin na olgeta tok nogut ol manmeri i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin.”

block.text: Tasol sapos man i mekim tok nogut long Holi Spirit, God bai i no inap lusim dispela sin bilong en, nau na bihain tu. Nogat. Dispela sin bai i stap long em oltaim oltaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: --because they said,

block.text: Jisas i tok olsem,
long wanem, ol i bin tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has an unclean spirit.”

block.text: "Em i gat spirit nogut i stap long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.

block.text: Long dispela taim mama wantaim ol brata bilong Jisas ol I kamap. Ol i sanap ausait, na ol i salim tok i go long em. Ol i laik bai em i kam long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him,

block.text: Bikpela lain manmeri i sindaun raunim em, na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”

block.text: "Harim. Mama bilong yu wantaim ol brata na susa bilong yu ol i stap ausait na i singaut long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na em i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are my mother and my brothers?”

block.text: "Husat em i mama na brata bilong mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said,

block.text: Em I lukluk raun long ol manmeri i sindaun raun long em, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

block.text: "Lukim mama bilong mi wantaim ol brata bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”

block.text: Man o meri i save bihainim laik bilong God, em i brata na susa na mama bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 4
Again he began to teach by the seaside. A great multitude was gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat in the sea, and sat down. All the multitude were on the land by the sea.

block.text: Jisas i kirapim wok gen long skulim ol manmeri long arere bilong raunwara. Na bikpela lain manmeri moa ol i kam long em. Olsem na em i kalap long wanpela bot i stap long raunwara, na em i sindaun long en. Na olgeta manmeri ol i stap long nambis klostu long wara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,

block.text: Na Jisas i mekim planti tok piksa long ol bilong skulim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Listen! Behold, a farmer went out to sow.

block.text: "Yupela harim. Wanpela man i go tromoi pikinini wit long gaden.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.

block.text: Em i wok long tromoi i go, na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long rot, na ol pisin i kam kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long hap graun i gat ston, na i no gat planti graun long en. Graun i no daun tumas, olsem na dispela wit i kamap kwik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

block.text: Tasol taim san i kam antap em i kukim dispela wit. Na wit i no gat rop, olsem na em i drai olgeta, na i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil. Na ol rop i gat nil ol i kamap na karamapim wit, na wit i no karim kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some brought forth thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”

block.text: Tasol sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun, na wit i kamap bikpela, na i karim kaikai. Sampela i karim 30, na sampela i karim 60, na sampela i karim 100 ."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: "Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
He said to them,

block.text: Taim ol bikpela lain manmeri i go pinis, orait ol 12 -pela disaipel wantaim ol man i save stap wantaim Jisas, ol i askim em long as bilong ol tok piksa.
Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you is given the mystery of the Kingdom of God, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,

block.text: "God i soim yupela pinis long as bilong tok hait bilong kingdom bilong God. Tasol ol man i stap ausait, ol i harim olgeta tok long tok piksa tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that ’seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.”

block.text: Olsem na 'Bai ol i lukluk planti taim, tasol bai ol i no luksave long wanpela samting. Na bai ol i harim tok planti taim, tasol bai ol i no save long as bilong en, nogut ol i tanim bel, na God i lusim sin bilong ol.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?

block.text: "Yupela i no save long as bilong dispela tok piksa, a? Olsem bai yupela i save olsem wanem long olgeta arapela tok piksa?

ReferenceBlocks.text: The farmer sows the word.

block.text: Dispela man i planim kaikai em i planim tok bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.

block.text: Tok i save pundaun long rot em i olsem ol lain manmeri ol i harim tok, na wantu tasol Satan i save kam na rausim dispela tok God i bin planim long bel bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.

block.text: Na sampela manmeri ol i olsem pikinini wit i pundaun long graun i gat ston. Ol i harim tok, na ol i save kisim kwiktaim, na ol i amamas long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.

block.text: Tasol ol i no gat rop bilong ol. Ol i save stap liklik taim tasol. Taim ol man i laik daunim tok bilong God ol i givim hevi long ol dispela manmeri na mekim nogut long ol, orait bilip bilong ol i save bagarap kwiktaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,

block.text: Na sampela manmeri ol i olsem pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil. Dispela lain ol i harim tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but the cares of this age, the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things enter in and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.

block.text: tasol ol i tingting planti long ol samting bilong graun na ol i wari long bungim planti mani na ol i mangal long ol kain kain samting. Ol dispela samting i karamapim tok bilong God, na em i no karim kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”

block.text: Tasol sampela manmeri ol i olsem pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun. Ol i harim tok, na ol i kisim na holim, na ol i karim kaikai. Sampela i karim 30, na sampela i karim 60, na sampela i karim 100 ."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn't it put on a stand?

block.text: "Ating ol man i save kisim lam i kam bilong putim aninit long wanpela baket o wanpela bet? Nogat. Ol i save putim antap long tebol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.

block.text: Olgeta samting i stap hait, bihain bai em i kamap long ples klia. Na olgeta samting ol man i karamapim i stap, bihain bai ol i kamap long ples klia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

block.text: "Tok yupela i harim, em yupela i mas tingim gut. Skel yupela i save givim long ol man, dispela skel tasol bai God i bekim long yupela. Na bai em i skruim sampela moa long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever has, to him will more be given, and he who doesn't have, even that which he has will be taken away from him.”

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i gat sampela samting pinis, orait God bai i givim sampela moa long em. Tasol sapos man i no gat ol samting, orait God bai i tekewe ol liklik samting em i holim pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of God is as if a man should cast seed on the earth.

block.text: "Kingdom bilong God em i olsem wanpela man i tromoi ol pikinini kaikai i go long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, he doesn't know how.

block.text: Na long olgeta nait dispela man i save slip, na long san em i save kirap na raun mekim wok bilong en. Na ol dispela pikinini kaikai i kamap na i go bikpela olsem wanem, em dispela man i no save.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All by itself, the earth bears fruit: first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.

block.text: Graun yet em i mekim na ol pikinini i kamap, na bihain ol i karim kaikai. Pastaim ol lip i kamap, na bihain ol het i kamap, na bihain kaikai i kamap bikpela insait long ol het.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the fruit is ripe, immediately he puts forth the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

block.text: Na taim kaikai i redi pinis bilong kisim, orait dispela man i save katim, long wanem, taim bilong kisim kaikai em i kamap pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How will we liken the Kingdom of God? Or with what parable will we illustrate it?

block.text: "Bai yumi tok, kingdom bilong God i olsem wanem samting? Yumi ken mekim wanem kain tok piksa?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It's like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth.

block.text: Em i olsem pikinini bilong dispela kain sayor ol i kolim mastet. Pikinini bilong mastet em i no olsem ol arapela pikinini kaikai bilong graun. Nogat. Em i liklik tru. Ol i save planim dispela long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”

block.text: Ol i planim pinis, na em i kamap na i go bikpela, na i winim olgeta kain sayor long gaden. Em i gat ol bikpela han, na ol pisin inap i kam long ol han bilong en na wokim haus bilong ol long ples kol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

block.text: Taim Jisas i autim tok long ol manmeri em i save mekim planti tok piksa olsem, inap long mak bilong tingting bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Without a parable he didn't speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.

block.text: Em i no autim klia wanpela tok long ol manmeri. Nogat. Em i save autim long tok piksa tasol. Na taim ol disaipel tasol i stap wantaim em, em i save autim as bilong olgeta tok long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that day, when evening had come, he said to them,

block.text: Long apinun long dispela de yet, Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go over to the other side.”

block.text: "Yumi go long hapsait bilong raunwara."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaving the multitude, they took him with them, even as he was, in the boat. Other small boats were also with him.

block.text: Orait ol i lusim dispela bikpela lain manmeri na ol i kalap long dispela bot Jisas I sindaun pinis long en, na ol i kisim em i go wantaim ol. Na ol arapela bot tu i go wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A big wind storm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so much that the boat was already filled.

block.text: Na traipela win i kirap, na si i kalap I go insait long bot, na wara i laik pulap long bot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion, and they woke him up, and told him,

block.text: Na Jisas I stap long stan bilong bot, na em i slip long wanpela pilo. Orait ol I kirapim em na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, don't you care that we are dying?”

block.text: "Tisa, klostu yumi laik lus, na ating yu no wari liklik long yumi bai i dai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea,

block.text: Na Jisas i kirap, na i krosim win, na i tokim wara olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace! Be still!”

block.text: "Inap nau. Yu pinis! Yu dai nau!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
He said to them,

block.text: Na win I dai, na wara i no mekim nais liklik.
Na em i askim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i pret? Yupela i no bilip, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were greatly afraid, and said to one another,

block.text: Na ol i pret nogut tru, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

block.text: "Dispela man em i husat tru, na win wantaim wara i harim tok bilong em?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 5
They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i go kamap long hapsait bilong raunwara Galili, long graun bilong ol Gerasa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come out of the boat, immediately a man with an unclean spirit met him out of the tombs.

block.text: Em i lusim bot pinis, na kwiktaim wanpela man i gat spirit nogut i kam bungim Jisas. Dispela man i stap nabaut long ples matmat na i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He lived in the tombs. Nobody could bind him any more, not even with chains.

block.text: Em i save slip long ples matmat. Na i no gat wanpela man inap long pasim em, maski ol i pasim em long sen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He had been often bound with fetters and chains, but he tore the chains apart and broke the fetters in pieces. Nobody had the strength to subdue him.

block.text: Planti taim ol i bin pasim em long ol hankap na sen. Tasol em i save brukim ol sen na hankap tu. Em i strong tumas, na i no gat man inap long holimpas em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.

block.text: Oltaim long san na long nait em i save stap long matmat na long ples maunten. Na em i save singaut nogut na katim skin bilong em yet long ston.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

block.text: Em i lukim Jisas i stap longwe yet, na em i ran i kam na i brukim skru klostu long lek bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and crying out with a loud voice, he said,

block.text: Na em i singaut bikmaus tru olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don't torment me.”

block.text: "Jisas, yu Pikinini bilong God Antap Tru, yu laik mekim wanem long mi? Mi askim yu strong long nem bilong God, yu no ken mekim nogut long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he said to him,

block.text: Em i singaut olsem, long wanem, Jisas i bin tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”

block.text: "Yu spirit nogut, yu mas lusim dispela man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is your name?”

block.text: "Wanem nem bilong yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na em i tok,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “My name is Legion, for we are many.”

block.text: "Nem bilong mi Ami. Long wanem, mipela i bikpela lain."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He begged him much, saying:

block.text: Na em i askim Jisas strong long em

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not send us out of the region.”

block.text: i no ken rausim ol dispela spirit nogut na mekim ol i lusim dispela hap graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now on the mountainside there was a great herd of pigs feeding.

block.text: Wanpela bikpela lain pik ol i kaikai i stap long liklik maunten klostu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the demons begged him, saying,

block.text: Na ol spirit nogut i askim Jisas strong olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send us into the pigs, that we may enter into them.”

block.text: "Yu mas salim mipela i go insait long ol dispela pik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: At once Jesus gave them permission. The unclean spirits came out
and entered into the pigs. The herd of about two thousand rushed
down the steep bank into the sea,
and they were drowned in the sea.

block.text: Orait Jisas i larim ol i go. Na ol spirit nogut i lusim dispela man,
na ol i go insait long ol pik. Na ol dispela lain pik i ran strong tru
i go daun long wanpela ples nogut. Na ol i pundaun long raunwara, na ol i dring wara na i dai.
Namba bilong olgeta pik em inap olsem 2,000 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.

block.text: Ol wasman bilong pik i lukim na ol i ranawe, na ol i bringim tok i go long taun na long ol hap nabaut. Na ol manmeri i kam lukim wanem samting tru i bin kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jesus, and saw him who had been possessed by demons sitting, clothed, and in his right mind, even him who had the legion; and they were afraid.

block.text: Ol i kamap long Jisas, na ol i lukim dispela man, bipo ol dispela planti spirit nogut i stap long en. Nau em i pasim laplap, na tingting bilong en i klia, na em i sindaun i stap. Ol manmeri i lukim, na ol i pret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who saw it told the people what had happened to the demon-posessed man -- and about the pigs.

block.text: Na ol man i bin lukim ol samting Jisas i mekim, ol i stori long ol manmeri long ol samting i bin kamap long dispela man, bipo ol spirit nogut i stap long en. Na ol i stori long ol pik tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to beg him, saying:

block.text: Ol manmeri i harim, na ol i tok strong long Jisas

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Depart from our borders.”

block.text: i mas lusim graun bilong ol na i go long narapela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus was entering into the boat, the man who had been possessed by demons begged him, saying:

block.text: Orait Jisas i kalap long bot. Na dispela man bipo ol spirit nogut i stap long en, em i askim Jisas strong olsem,

block.characterId: man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let me go with you.”

block.text: "Inap yu larim mi i go wantaim yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He didn't allow him, but said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i no laik. Em i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go to your house, to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how he had mercy on you.”

block.text: "Yu go long haus bilong yu na long ol wanlain bilong yu. Na yu tokim ol long olgeta samting Bikpela i bin mekim bilong helpim yu, na long em i bin marimari long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went his way, and began to proclaim in Decapolis how Jesus had done great things for him, and everyone marveled.

block.text: Olsem na dispela man i go, na em i wok long autim tok long olgeta hap bilong distrik Dekapolis long olgeta samting Jisas i bin mekim bilong helpim em. Na olgeta manmeri i harim na ol i tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus had crossed back over in the boat to the other side, a great multitude was gathered to him; and he was by the sea.

block.text: Orait Jisas i go long bot na i brukim raunwara Galili gen. Em i kamap long hapsait, na bikpela lain manmeri ol i kam bung bilong harim tok bilong em. Na Jisas i stap klostu long raunwara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name, came; and seeing him, he fell at his feet,

block.text: Na wanpela hetman bilong haus lotu i kam, nem bilong en Jairus. Em i lukim Jisas na i kam brukim skru klostu long lek bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and begged him much, saying,

block.text: Na em i askim Jisas strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.”

block.text: "Liklik pikinini meri bilong mi klostu i laik i dai. Plis, yu mas kam putim han long em, na bai em i orait gen na i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went with him, and a great multitude followed him, and they pressed upon him on all sides.

block.text: Na Jisas i go wantaim em. em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years.

block.text: Na wanpela meri i stap, em i save karim blut oltaim na i stap olsem inap long 12 -pela yia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She had suffered many things by many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was no better, but rather grew worse.

block.text: Dispela meri i bin lukim planti dokta, na ol i bin givim planti pen long em, na em i bin lusim olgeta mani bilong en bilong baim ol. Tasol sik bilong en i no orait liklik. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having heard the things concerning Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.
For she said,

block.text: Dispela meri em i bin harim stori bilong Jisas. Olsem na em i kam, na em i stap namel long dispela bikpela lain manmeri. Em i kam klostu long baksait bilong Jisas, na i putim han long longpela klos bilong Jisas.
Em i bin tokim em yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”

block.text: "Sapos mi putim han tasol long klos bilong em, bai mi orait gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.

block.text: Meri i putim han long klos bilong Jisas na wantu tasol blut bilong en i drai, na long bodi bilong en em i pilim dispela sik i go pinis nau.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power had gone out from him, turned around in the crowd, and asked,

block.text: Na Jisas i save, sampela strong I lusim em na i go. Olsem na em i tanim na i askim olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who touched my clothes?”

block.text: "Husat i putim han long klos bilong mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples said to him,

block.text: Na ol disaipel i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

block.text: "Yu lukim bikpela lain manmeri i pas long yu. Na bilong wanem yu tok, 'Husat i putim han long mi?' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked around to see her who had done this thing.

block.text: Tasol Jisas i lukluk raun bilong painimaut husat i bin holim klos bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
He said to her,

block.text: Na dispela meri i save long dispela samting i bin kamap long em, na em i pret na i guria. Na em i kam brukim skru klostu long Jisas, na i tokaut klia long olgeta samting.
Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”

block.text: "Pikinini, yu bilip long mi, olsem na yu kamap orait gen. Yu go, na bel bilong yu i ken i stap isi. Sik bilong yu i ken pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue ruler's house saying,

block.text: Jisas i toktok yet i stap, na sampela man bilong haus bilong hetman bilong haus lotu ol i kam. Ol i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your daughter is dead. Why bother the Teacher any more?”

block.text: "Pikinini bilong yu i dai pinis. Maski givim hevi moa long tisa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, when he heard the message spoken, immediately said to the ruler of the synagogue,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i no givim yau long dispela tok ol i mekim. Em I tokim hetman bilong haus lotu olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be afraid, only believe.”

block.text: "Yu no ken pret. Yu mas bilip tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He allowed no one to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

block.text: Na em i tambuim ol manmeri long ol i no ken i go wantaim em. Pita na Jems na Jon, brata bilong Jems, tripela tasol i go wantaim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to the synagogue ruler's house, and he saw an uproar, weeping, and great wailing.

block.text: Ol i go kamap long haus bilong hetman bilong haus lotu, na Jisas i lukim ol manmeri i mekim bikpela nois. Ol i wok long krai nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had entered in, he said to them,

block.text: Na em i go insait na i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you make an uproar and weep? The child is not dead, but is asleep.”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i krai na mekim bikpela nois? Dispela pikinini em i no i dai. Em i slip tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they laughed at him. After he put them all out of the room, he took the father of the child, her mother, and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.

block.text: But they laughed at him. Tasol em i rausim olgeta manmeri i go ausait. Na em i kisim papa na mama bilong pikinini, wantaim tripela disaipel bilong en, na ol i go insait long rum pikinini i stap long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Taking the child by the hand, he said to her,

block.text: Na em i holim han bilong pikinini na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Talitha cumi!”

block.text: "Talita, kum."

ReferenceBlocks.text: which means, being interpreted,

block.text: Mining bilong dispela tok i olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”

block.text: "Liklik meri, mi tokim yu, yu kirap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the girl rose up and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.

block.text: Na kwiktaim dispela liklik meri i kirap na i wokabaut. Na ol i lukim dispela, na ol i kirap nogut tru. Dispela meri i gat 12 -pela krismas pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He strictly ordered them, saying:

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one about this!”

block.text: "Yupela i no ken tokim wanpela man long dispela samting i bin kamap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said:

block.text: Na em i tokim ol long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give her something to eat.”

block.text: givim sampela kaikai long dispela liklik meri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 6
He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

block.text: Jisas i lusim dispela ples na i go long as ples bilong en. Na ol disaipel bilong en ol i bihainim em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Sabbath had come, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying,

block.text: Long de Sabat em I go long haus lotu na i givim tok bilong God long ol manmeri. Na planti bilong ol manmeri i harim tok bilong en, ol i kirap nogut na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where did this man get these things?” and, “What is the wisdom that is given to this man, that such mighty works come about by his hands?

block.text: "Dispela man em i kisim dispela tok we? Dispela save i stap long en, em i wanem kain save? Na olsem wanem na em i wokim olkain mirakel tu?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn't this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren't his sisters here with us?”

block.text: Yumi save, dispela man em i wanpela kamda. Em i pikinini bilong Maria, na em i brata bilong Jems na Josep na Judas na Saimon. Ol susa bilong en ol i stap hia wantaim yumi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were offended at him.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Ol i tok olsem, na ol i bel nogut long em.
Tasol Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”

block.text: "Profet i gat nem long olgeta ples. Tasol long as ples bilong en, na namel long ol wanblut bilong en, na long haus bilong en stret, em i no gat nem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He could do no mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people, and healed them.

block.text: Na em i no inap long wokim wanpela mirakel long dispela ples. Em i putim han long ol wan wan sikman tasol na i mekim ol i orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.

block.text: Na em i tingting planti long ol dispela manmeri i no bilip long em. Orait Jisas I go raun long ol ples long dispela hap, na em I givim tok bilong God long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called to himself the twelve, and said to them:

block.text: Na em i singautim ol 12 -pela disaipel i kam, na em i salim ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am sending you out two by two and I am giving you authority over the unclean spirits”

block.text: i go tupela tupela. Em i givim strong long ol bilong rausim ol spirit nogut i stap long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he told them:

block.text: Na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take nothing for your journey, except a staff: no bread, no wallet, no money in your purse.

block.text: ol i ken holim stik bilong wokabaut, tasol ol i no ken kisim ol arapela samting bilong wokabaut i go wantaim ol. Ol i no ken kisim bret na ol i no ken karim hanbek samting na ol i no ken karim mani long poket bilong ol. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wear sandals, but only one tunic.”

block.text: Ol i ken putim su, tasol ol i no ken putim tupela siot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Wherever you enter into a house, stay there until you depart from there.

block.text: "Sapos yupela i kamap long wanpela ples na yupela i go insait long wanpela haus, orait yupela i mas i stap long dispela haus tasol inap long taim yupela i lusim dispela ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever will not receive you nor hear you, as you depart from there, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony against them. Assuredly, I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”

block.text: Na sapos long sampela ples ol i no kisim yupela i go long haus bilong ol, na ol i no laik harim tok bilong yupela, orait yupela i mas lusim dispela ples. Na taim yupela i laik i go, yupela i mas rausim pipia graun i stap long lek bilong yupela, bai ol i ken save, ol i gat asua long dispela pasin ol i mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out and preached that people should repent.

block.text: Orait ol disaipel i go, na ol i autim tok long ol manmeri olsem, "Yupela i mas tanim bel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

block.text: Na ol i rausim planti spirit nogut i stap long ol manmeri, na ol i putim wel long planti sikman na mekim ol i kamap orait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: King Herod heard this, for his name had become known, and he said,

block.text: King Herot i harim tok long ol dispela samting i kamap, long wanem, Jisas i gat nem pinis long olgeta hap. Sampela manmeri i save tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer has risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”

block.text: "Em Jon Bilong Baptais i kirap bek long matmat. Olsem na em i gat strong bilong wokim ol dispela mirakel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But others said,

block.text: Na sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is Elijah.”

block.text: "Em Elaija.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others said,

block.text: Na sampela i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is a prophet, or like one of the prophets.”

block.text: "Em i profet, wankain olsem ol profet bilong bipo."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Herod, when he heard this, said,

block.text: Herot i harim dispela, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is John, whom I beheaded. He has risen from the dead.”

block.text: "Bipo mi katim nek bilong Jon, tasol nau em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested and put in prison. He did this because he had married Herodius, his brother Philip's wife.
John had been saying to Herod:

block.text: Bipo Herot I bin maritim Herodias, em meri bilong Filip, brata bilong Herot. Na Jon i bin tokim Herot olsem, Olsem na Herot i bin salim ol man i go holimpas Jon na pasim em long sen long haus kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.”

block.text: "Yu kisim meri bilong brata bilong yu, em i no stret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him, but she couldn't.

block.text: Herodias em i bel nogut tru long Jon, na i laik kilim em i dai, tasol em i no inap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Herod feared John. He knew that John was a righteous and holy man and so he kept him safe. When he heard him, he did many things, and he heard him gladly.

block.text: Long wanem, Herot i pret long Jon. Em i save, Jon em i gutpela na stretpela man long ai bilong God. Olsem na Herot i save was gut long em. Taim em i harim tok bilong Jon, em i save tingting planti, na bel bilong en i hevi. Tasol em i laikim tumas long harim tok bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then a convenient day came, that Herod on his birthday made a supper for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.

block.text: Bihain Herodias i painim rot olsem. Herot i mekim wanpela bikpela kaikai bilong tingim de mama i bin karim em. Em i mekim dispela kaikai bilong ol bikman i save helpim em long wok bilong gavman, na bilong ol namba wan ofisa bilong ami, na bilong ol bikman bilong distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and those sitting with him. The king said to the young lady,

block.text: Orait ol i kaikai i stap na pikinini meri bilong Herodias i kam insait na i danis. Na Herot wantaim ol man i kaikai wantaim em, ol i laikim tumas dispela danis. Olsem na king i tokim dispela yangpela meri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”

block.text: "Mi bai givim yu wanem samting yu laikim. Yu tokim mi tasol, na bai mi givim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He swore to her,

block.text: Na Herot i mekim strongpela promis olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whatever you shall ask of me, I will give you, up to half of my kingdom.”

block.text: "Tru antap, wanem samting yu askim long mi, em bai mi givim yu. Sapos yu tok long mi mas brukim kantri bilong mi long tupela hap na givim wanpela hap long yu, orait bai mi mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She went out, and said to her mother,

block.text: Na dispela meri i go ausait na I askim mama bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What shall I ask?”

block.text: "Bai mi tokim em long givim wanem samting long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said,

block.text: Na mama i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The head of John the Baptizer.”

block.text: "Yu tokim em long kisim het bilong Jon Bilong Baptais na givim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She came in immediately with haste to the king, and asked,

block.text: Orait yangpela meri i hariap i go bek long king, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.”

block.text: "Nau tasol mi laik bai yu putim het bilong Jon Bilong Baptais long wanpela plet, na givim long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king was exceedingly sorry, but for the sake of his oaths, and of his dinner guests, he didn't wish to refuse her.

block.text: King i harim dispela tok na bel bilong en i hevi moa. Tasol em i ting long strongpela promis em i bin mekim, na em i no laik kisim sem long ai bilong ol man i sindaun kaikai wantaim em. Olsem na em i no laik sakim tok bilong dispela meri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the king sent out a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring John's head, and he went and beheaded him in the prison,

block.text: Orait kwiktaim king i salim wanpela soldia i go bilong kisim het bilong Jon i kam. Dispela soldia i go long haus kalabus, na i katim nek bilong Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the young lady; and the young lady gave it to her mother.

block.text: Na em i putim het bilong Jon long wanpela plet na i bringim i kam na i givim long yangpela meri. Na yangpela meri em i givim long mama bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his disciples heard this, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong Jon i harim tok long dispela samting Herot i bin mekim, na ol i kam kisim bodi bilong Jon na karim i go planim long matmat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles gathered themselves together to Jesus, and they told him all things, whatever they had done, and whatever they had taught.
He said to them,

block.text: Ol aposel i kam bek na ol i bung wantaim Jisas. Na ol i stori long ol wok ol i bin mekim, na long olgeta tok ol i bin givim long ol manmeri.
Olsem na Jisas i tokim ol aposel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come with me to a deserted place, and rest awhile.”

block.text: "Goan, yumi tasol i go long wanpela hap i no gat man, na bai yupela i ken malolo liklik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.

block.text: Tasol planti manmeri i wok long i go i kam, na Jisas wantaim ol aposel i no gat taim bilong kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away in the boat to a deserted place by themselves.

block.text: Na ol i kisim bot, na ol I go long wanpela hap i no gat man. Ol tasol i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They saw them going, and many recognized him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to him.

block.text: Tasol planti manmeri i lukim ol i go, na ol i luksave long ol. Olsem na ol manmeri bilong olgeta taun i ran i go long dispela hap ol lain bilong Jisas i laik i go long en, na ol i kamap paslain long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus came out, saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd, and he began to teach them many things.

block.text: Olsem na taim Jisas i go sua em i lukim bikpela lain manmeri i stap. Na em i sori tru long ol, long wanem, ol i olsem ol sipsip i no gat wasman. Na em i stat long givim planti tok long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was late in the day, his disciples came to him, and said,

block.text: Na bihain, taim san i laik i go daun, ol disaipel bilong Jisas i kam long em na tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This place is deserted, and it is late in the day.

block.text: "Dispela hap i no gat man, na san i laik i go daun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages, and buy themselves bread, for they have nothing to eat.”

block.text: Mobeta yu salim ol manmeri i go. Ol i ken i go long ol hap nabaut na long ol ples, na baim kaikai bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You give them something to eat.”

block.text: "Yupela yet givim kaikai long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Na ol I askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread, and give them something to eat?”

block.text: "Ating yu laik bai mipela i go baim bret long 200 kina na givim long ol, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i askim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have? Go see.”

block.text: "Yupela i gat hamas bret I stap? Yupela go lukim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they knew, they said,

block.text: Ol i lukim pinis, orait ol i kam tok Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Five, and two fish.”

block.text: "Mipela i gat 5 -pela bret na tupela pis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded his disciples, saying:

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell everyone to sit down in groups on the green grass.”

block.text: "Olgeta manmeri i mas bung bung na sindaun long gutpela gras."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.

block.text: Orait ol i sindaun, na sampela lain inap long 100 man, na sampela inap long 50 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he gave to his disciples to set before them, and he divided the two fish among them all.

block.text: Na Jisas i kisim dispela 5 -pela bret wantaim tupela pis. Na em i lukluk i go long heven, na i givim tenkyu long God. Na em i brukim ol bret na i givim long ol disaipel, bai ol i tilim i go long ol manmeri. Na tupela pis tu em i brukim na tilim i go long olgeta manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled.

block.text: Na olgeta i kaikai, na ol i pulap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.

block.text: Na olgeta hap bret na pis i stap yet, em ol i bungim na pulapim 12 -pela basket.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

block.text: Ol man i kaikai dispela bret, ol inap 5,000 man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he ordered his disciples:

block.text: Orait Jisas i hariapim ol disaipel bilong en, na i tokim ol long ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get into the boat and go to the other side, to Bethsaida.”

block.text: i mas kalap long bot na i go paslain long em long hapsait bilong raunwara, long ples Betsaida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent the multitude away.

block.text: Em yet i laik i stap na salim ol manmeri i go pastaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After he had taken leave of them, he went up the mountain to pray.

block.text: Em i salim ol manmeri i go pinis, orait em i go antap long maunten, bilong em i ken beten.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, the boat was in the midst of the sea, and he was alone on the land.

block.text: Long apinun tru bot i stap namel long raunwara, na Jisas wanpela em i stap long nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he came to them, walking on the sea, and he would have passed by them.

block.text: Na em i lukim win i kam long poret bilong bot na i sakim ol, na ol i hatwok tru long pul. Klostu long tulait, orait Jisas i wokabaut antap long raunwara na i go long ol. Em i laik abrusim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they saw him walking on the sea, they cried out:

block.text: tasol ol disaipel i lukim em i wokabaut antap long raunwara, na ol i ting em i wanpela masalai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It's a ghost!”

block.text: Na ol i singaut nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he immediately spoke with them, and said to them,

block.text: Olgeta i lukim em, na ol i pret tumas. Tasol kwiktaim Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! It is I! Don't be afraid.”

block.text: "Yupela stap strong. Em mi tasol. Yupela i no ken pret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He got into the boat with them; and the wind ceased, and they were very amazed among themselves, and marveled;

block.text: Na em i go insait long bot, na i stap wantaim ol, na win i dai. Na ol i kirap nogut tru,

ReferenceBlocks.text: for they hadn't understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

block.text: long wanem, ol i no klia gut long as bilong dispela samting Jisas i bin mekim taim em i tilim bret long ol manmeri. Nogat. Tingting bilong ol i pas yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i brukim raunwara pinis, na ol i go sua long hap bilong Genesaret, na ol i pasim bot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come out of the boat, immediately the people recognized him.

block.text: Ol i lusim bot pinis, na kwiktaim ol manmeri i lukim Jisas na i luksave long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ran around that whole region, and began to bring those who were sick, on their mats, to wherever they heard people say:

block.text: Na ol man i ran i go nabaut long olgeta ples long dispela hap na tokim ol manmeri. Na taim ol manmeri i harim tok long Jisas i stap long wanpela hap, ol i slipim ol sikman long bet,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus is here.”

block.text: na ol i karim ol i go long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wherever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and begged him, saying:

block.text: Na long olgeta ples na olgeta taun na olgeta hap nabaut Jisas i kamap long en, ol i save putim ol sikman long ol ples bung. Na ol i askim Jisas strong long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Just let me touch the fringe of your garment!”

block.text: larim ol sikman i putim han long arere bilong klos bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And all those who touched him were healed.

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i mekim olsem, ol i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 7
Then the Pharisees, and some of the scribes gathered together to him, having come from Jerusalem.

block.text: Ol Farisi i bung wantaim sampela saveman bilong lo ol i bin lusim Jerusalem na i kam, na ol i go lukim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they saw some of his disciples eating bread with defiled, that is, unwashed, hands, they found fault.

block.text: Na ol i lukim sampela disaipel bilong en ol i kaikai, na ol i no wasim han bilong ol pastaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, don't eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.

block.text: Ol Farisi na olgeta Juda ol i save bihainim pasin bilong ol tumbuna, na sapos ol i no wasim han gut pastaim, ol i no save kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They don't eat when they come from the marketplace, unless they bathe themselves, and there are many other things, which they have received to hold to: washings of cups, pitchers, bronze vessels, and couches.)

block.text: Taim ol i go long maket na ol i kam bek, orait sapos ol i no waswas, ol i no save kaikai. Na ol i save bihainim planti arapela pasin tu ol i bin kisim long ol tumbuna olsem, ol i save wasim ol kap na sospen na dis na bet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees and the scribes asked him,

block.text: Orait na ol Farisi na ol saveman bilong lo i askim Jisas olsem,
