ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why don't your disciples walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with unwashed hands?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na ol disaipel bilong yu ol i no save bihainim pasin bilong ol tumbuna? Han bilong ol i doti na ol I kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

block.text: "Profet Aisaia em i makim tru yupela man bilong giaman. Em i bin raitim tok olsem, 'Ol dispela lain manmeri ol i save litimapim nem bilong mi long maus bilong ol, tasol bel na tingting bilong ol i stap longwe tru long mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

block.text: Ol i save autim lo bilong ol man tasol na tok, "Dispela em i tok bilong God." Olsem na ol i lotu nating long mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For you set aside the commandment of God, and hold tightly to the tradition of men--the washing of pitchers and cups, and you do many other such things.”

block.text: Yupela i lusim pinis lo bilong God, na yupela i holim strong pasin bilong ol man tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Full well do you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.

block.text: "Yupela i save tumas long sakim lo bilong God na bihainim pasin bilong yupela yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother;’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’

block.text: Moses i bin tok, 'Yu mas aninit long papamama bilong yu na bihainim tok bilong ol,' na 'Man i mekim tok nogut long papa o mama bilong en, em i mas i dai.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you say, ‘If a man tells his father or his mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban, that is to say, given to God”’;

block.text: Tasol yupela i save tok olsem, 'Sapos wanpela man i gat mani samting bilong helpim papa o mama bilong en, tasol em i tokim tupela, "Dispela mani mi makim pinis bilong givim long God,"

ReferenceBlocks.text: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother.

block.text: orait dispela man i no ken mekim ol samting bilong helpim papamama.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: You make void the word of God by your tradition, which you have handed down. You do many things like this.”

block.text: Olsem na yupela i bihainim pasin yupela i bin kisim long ol tumbuna, na yupela i daunim tok bilong God. Na yupela i save mekim planti kain pasin olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called all the multitude to himself, and said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i singautim gen ol manmeri, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear me, all of you, and understand.

block.text: "Yupela olgeta harim tok bilong mi na tingim gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There is nothing from outside of the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.

block.text: Samting i stap ausait long wanpela man na i go insait long en, em i no inap mekim dispela man i doti. Nogat. Ol samting i stap insait long man na i kam ausait, em tasol i mekim dispela man i doti."

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”

block.text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.}

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had entered into a house away from the multitude, his disciples asked him about the parable.
He said to them,

block.text: Jisas i lusim dispela lain manmeri na i go long haus. Na ol disaipel bilong en i askim em long as bilong dispela tok piksa.
Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you thus without understanding also? Don't you see that whatever goes into a man from outside can't defile him?

block.text: "Yupela tu i no gat tingting, a? Ating yupela i no save, olgeta samting i stap ausait long man na i go insait long en, em i no inap mekim man i doti?

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is because it doesn't go into his heart, but into his stomach, then into the latrine, thus purifying all foods.”

block.text: Mi tok olsem, long wanem, kain samting olsem em i no i go insait tru long bel bilong man. Nogat. Em i go long rot bilong pekpek tasol, na bihain em i go daun long smolhaus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thus he declared all foods clean
Jesus also said,

block.text: Long dispela tok Jisas em i tok olsem olgeta kain kaikai i klin long ai bilong God.
Na Jisas i tok moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That which proceeds out of a man, that is what defiles a man.

block.text: "Samting i stap insait long man na i kam ausait, dispela em i save mekim man i doti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For from within, out of the hearts of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, sexual sins, murders, thefts,

block.text: Mi tok long olkain samting i save kamap long tingting bilong man, em ol samting olsem, ol tingting nogut na pasin pamuk na pasin bilong stil na pasin bilong kilim man i dai

ReferenceBlocks.text: covetings, wickedness, deceit, lustful desires, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, and foolishness.

block.text: na pasin bilong pamuk wantaim ol marit na pasin bilong mangal na ol kain kain pasin nogut na pasin bilong giaman na hambak nabaut na pasin bilong bel nogut na tok nogut long ol arapela na pasin bilong bikhet na longlong pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All these evil things come from within, and defile the man.”

block.text: Olgeta dispela pasin nogut em i stap insait long man na i kam ausait na i mekim man i doti long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: From there he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. He entered into a house, and didn't want anyone to know it, but he couldn't escape notice.

block.text: Jisas i kirap na i lusim dispela ples, na i go long hap bilong taun Tair. Em i go insait long wanpela haus, na em i no laik long wanpela man i save olsem em i stap. Tasol em i no inap i stap hait. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.

block.text: Wanpela meri i harim tok long em i stap. Dispela meri i gat pikinini meri, na spirit nogut i stap long em. Olsem na dispela meri i kam kwiktaim na i brukim skru klostu long lek bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him, saying:

block.text: Dispela meri em i bilong narapela lain. Em i bilong ol lain Fonisia i stap long kantri Siria. Em i askim Jisas strong long em

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Please cast the demon out of my daughter!”

block.text: i mas rausim spirit nogut i stap long pikinini meri bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let the children be filled first, for it is not appropriate to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs.”

block.text: "Yumi mas givim kaikai long ol pikinini pastaim. Nogut yumi kisim kaikai bilong ol pikinini na tromoi i go long ol dok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But she answered him,

block.text: Tasol meri i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord. Yet even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.”

block.text: "Bikpela, ol dok i stap aninit long tebol ol tu i save kisim hap kaikai bilong ol pikinini."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to her,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For this saying, go your way. The demon has gone out of your daughter.”

block.text: "Yu tok olsem, orait yu ken i go bek. Spirit nogut i lusim pinis pikinini bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She went away to her house, and found the child having been laid on the bed, with the demon gone out.

block.text: Na meri i go bek long haus bilong en, na i lukim pikinini i slip long bet, na spirit nogut i lusim em pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the region of Decapolis.

block.text: Nau Jisas i kirap gen na i lusim hap bilong Tair, na i go long distrik bilong taun Saidon. Na em i go moa long hap bilong Dekapolis, na i kamap long raunwara Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought to him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech. They begged him to lay his hand on him.

block.text: Na ol i bringim wanpela man i kam long em, yau bilong en i pas na tang bilong en i hevi, na em i no inap toktok gut. Na ol i askim Jisas long putim han long dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took him aside from the multitude, privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue.

block.text: Na Jisas i kisim man i go, na i lusim ol manmeri, na tupela tasol i stap. Na Jisas i putim pinga long tupela yau bilong dispela man. Na bihain Jisas i spet long pinga bilong em yet, na i putim pinga long tang bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Looking up to heaven, he sighed, and said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk i go antap long heven, na em i pilim olsem em i laik krai na em i pulim win strong. Na em i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Ephphatha!”

block.text: "Efata."

ReferenceBlocks.text: that is,

block.text: Mining bilong dispela tok i olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be opened!”

block.text: "Yu op."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.

block.text: Na kwiktaim yau bilong dispela man i op, na samting i pasim tang bilong en i lus na em inap toktok gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded them, saying:

block.text: Na Jisas i tambuim ol manmeri strong long ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one of this.”

block.text: i no ken tokim wanpela man long dispela samting ol i lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the more he told them not to proclaim it, the more widely they did proclaim it.

block.text: Em i tambuim ol tru, tasol nogat, ol i strong moa yet long autim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were astonished beyond measure, saying,

block.text: Na ol manmeri i harim dispela tok, ol i kirap nogut tru na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has done all things well. He makes even the deaf hear, and the mute speak!”

block.text: "Olgeta samting em i mekim, em i mekim gutpela tasol. Em i mekim ol yaupas i harim tok, na ol mauspas i toktok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 8
In those days, when there was a very great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to himself, and said to them,

block.text: Long dispela taim bikpela lain manmeri i kam bung gen, na ol i no gat kaikai. Na Jisas i singautim ol disaipel bilong en i kam, na em i tokim ol olsem:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have stayed with me now three days, and have nothing to eat.

block.text: "Mi sori long dispela ol manmeri. Ol i stap wantaim mi inap tripela de pinis, na ol i no gat kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way, for some of them have come a long way.”

block.text: Na sapos ol i stap hangre na mi salim ol i go long haus bilong ol, bai ai bilong ol i raun na ol i pundaun long rot. Sampela ol i bin wokabaut longwe na i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples answered him,

block.text: Na ol disaipel i bekim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From where could one satisfy these people with bread here in a deserted place?”

block.text: "Dispela hap i no gat man. Na bai yumi inap kisim bret we na yumi givim kaikai long ol dispela manmeri?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked them,

block.text: Jisas i askim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How many loaves do you have?”

block.text: "Yupela i gat hamas bret I stap?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven.”

block.text: " 7 -pela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the multitude, saying:

block.text: Orait na Jisas i tokim ol manmeri,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sit down on the ground.”

block.text: na ol i sindaun long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, taking the seven loaves, he gave thanks and then broke them and gave them to his disciples to give to the people, and they did so.

block.text: Na em i kisim dispela 7 -pela bret, na em i tenkyu long God, na em i brukim na givim long ol disaipel, bilong ol i ken tilim. Na ol i tilim long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to give them to the people as well.

block.text: Na ol i gat ol wan wan liklik pis tu. Na Jisas i tenkyu long God long ol dispela pis, na em i tokim ol disaipel long tilim ol tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: Taim ol manmeri i kaikai na i pulap, ol i bungim ol liklik hap kaikai i stap yet, na i pulapim 7 -pela basket.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who had eaten were about four thousand. Then he sent them away.

block.text: Namba bilong dispela ol manmeri em inap olsem 4,000 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the region of Dalmanutha.

block.text: na kwiktaim em i kalap long bot wantaim ol disaipel bilong en, na ol i go long hap bilong distrik Dalmanuta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees came and began to question him. To test him they said:

block.text: Ol Farisi I kam na ol i stat long tok pait wantaim Jisas. Ol i tok em

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven!”

block.text: i mas wokim wanpela mirakel olsem mak bilong soim ol olsem em i mekim wok bilong God. Ol i laik traim em tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sighed deeply in his spirit, and said,

block.text: Jisas i pilim hevi long spirit bilong en, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does this generation seek a sign? Most certainly I tell you, no sign will be given to this generation.”

block.text: "Bilong wanem ol manmeri bilong dispela taim I singaut long lukim mak? Mi tok tru long yupela, ol bai i no inap lukim wanpela mak. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He left them, and again entering into the boat, departed to the other side.

block.text: Na em i lusim ol na i kalap long bot gen, na i go long hapsait bilong raunwara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They forgot to take bread; and they didn't have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
He warned them, saying,

block.text: Ol disaipel i lusim tingting na ol i no kisim bret i kam wantaim. Ol i gat wanpela bret tasol i stap long bot.
Na Jisas i tok strong long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take heed: beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and the yeast of Herod.”

block.text: "Yupela was gut. Yupela lukaut long yis bilong ol Farisi na long yis bilong Herot."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with one another, saying,

block.text: Orait ol disaipel i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It's because we have no bread.”

block.text: "Ating em i mekim dispela tok, long wanem, yumi no gat bret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving it, said to them,

block.text: Jisas i save long dispela toktok ol i mekim, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you reason that it's because you have no bread? Don't you perceive yet, neither understand? Is your heart still hardened?

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i toktok nabaut olsem, 'Yumi no gat bret'? Ating yupela i no klia yet? Ating yupela i no gat save yet? Ating tingting bilong yupela i pas, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having eyes, don't you see? Having ears, don't you hear? Don't you remember?

block.text: Yupela i gat ai, tasol yupela i no lukim ol samting, a? Yupela i gat yau, tasol yupela i no harim tok, a? Yupela i lusim tingting pinis, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I broke the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: Taim mi brukim 5 -pela bret long ol 5,000 man, yupela i pulapim hamas basket long hap bret i stap yet?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Twelve.”

block.text: " 12 -pela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the seven loaves fed the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you take up?”

block.text: "Na taim mi brukim 7 -pela bret long ol 4,000 man, yupela i pulapim hamas basket long hap bret i stap yet?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Seven.”

block.text: " 7 -pela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He asked them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't you understand, yet?”

block.text: "Yupela i no save yet, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Bethsaida. They brought a blind man to him, and begged him to touch him.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i go kamap long ples Betsaida. Na ol i bringim wanpela man i kam long em, ai bilong en i pas. Na ol I tokim Jisas long putim han long dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village. When he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands on him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i holim han bilong dispela man aipas, na em i bringim em i go ausait long ples. Na em i spet long ai bilong em, na i putim han antap long em, na I askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see anything?”

block.text: "Yu lukim wanpela samting, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He looked up, and said,

block.text: Na dispela man i lukluk, na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I see men but they look likes trees walking around.”

block.text: "Mi lukim sampela man. Tasol mi lukim ol i olsem ol diwai i wokabaut i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then again he laid his hands on his eyes. He looked intently, and was restored, and saw everyone clearly.

block.text: Na Jisas i putim han gen long ai bilong em. Na dispela man i lukluk strong, na ai bilong en i kamap gutpela, na em i lukim olgeta samting i kamap klia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent him away to his house, saying,

block.text: Na Jisas I salim em i go long haus bilong en, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't enter into the village, nor tell anyone in the village.”

block.text: "Yu no ken i go insait long ples."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, with his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked his disciples,

block.text: Jisas i kirap wantaim ol disaipel bilong en, na ol i go long ol ples i stap klostu long taun Sisaria Filipai. Na long rot em i askim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do men say that I am?”

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save tok, mi husat tru?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer, and others say Elijah, but others: one of the prophets.”

block.text: "Sampela ol i save tok, yu Jon Bilong Baptais. Na sampela i tok, yu Elaija. Na sampela i save tok, yu wanpela profet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: "Na yupela yet i tok mi husat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Na Pita i bekim tok bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are the Christ.”

block.text: "Yu dispela man God i bin makim bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: Na Jisas i tambuim ol long ol

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one about me.”

block.text: i no ken tokim wanpela man long em i husat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus began to teach them, saying:

block.text: Orait Jisas i stat long skulim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.”

block.text: "Pikinini Bilong Man em i mas karim planti pen, na ol hetman na ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo bai ol i givim baksait long em na kilim em i dai. Na long de namba 3 bai em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

block.text: Em i autim dispela tok klia tru long ol. Na Pita i kisim Jisas i go long arere na i stat long krosim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tanim na i lukluk long ol disaipel bilong en, na em i krosim Pita olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.”

block.text: "Satan, yu go baksait long mi. Yu no bihainim tingting bilong God. Nogat. Yu bihainim tingting bilong ol man tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called the multitude to himself with his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i singautim ol manmeri i kam long em, wantaim ol disaipel bilong en. Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever wants to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i laik bihainim mi, orait em i mas daunim laik bilong em yet, na em i mas karim diwai kros bilong en na bihainim mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it; and whoever will lose his life for my sake and the sake of the Good News will save it.

block.text: Long wanem, sapos wanpela man i laik holimpas laip bilong em yet, laip bilong en bai i lus. Tasol sapos wanpela man i ting long mi na long gutnius bilong mi, na em i lusim laip bilong en, orait laip bilong en bai i stap gut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i kisim olgeta samting bilong graun, tasol laip bilong em yet i lus, orait dispela olgeta samting bai i helpim em olsem wanem?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what will a man give in exchange for his life?

block.text: Bai man i givim wanem pe bilong baim bek laip bilong en?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man also will be ashamed of him, when he comes in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.”

block.text: Ol manmeri bilong dispela taim ol i save givim baksait long God na mekim ol kain kain pasin nogut. Na sapos wanpela man bilong ol em i sem long mi na long tok bilong mi, orait bihain, taim Pikinini Bilong Man i stap long bikpela lait bilong Papa bilong en na em i kam wantaim ol ensel bilong God, em bai i sem long dispela man tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 9
He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste death until they see the Kingdom of God come with power.”

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela, sampela man i sanap hia bai ol i no i dai yet, na bai ol i lukim kingdom bilong God i kamap wantaim bikpela strong bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: After six days Jesus took with him Peter, James, and John, and brought them up onto a high mountain privately by themselves, and he was changed into another form in front of them.

block.text: 6-pela de i go pinis, orait Jisas i kisim Pita na Jems na Jon, na em i bringim ol i go long wanpela maunten i antap moa. Na ol tasol i stap. Na taim ol i lukluk i stap, bodi bilong Jisas i senis na em i kamap narakain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His clothing became glistening, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.

block.text: Ol laplap samting bilong en i kamap olsem lait, na i waitpela tru. I no gat wanpela man long graun em inap long mekim laplap i kamap waitpela olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Elijah and Moses appeared to them, and they were talking with Jesus.
Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: Na Elaija wantaim Moses tupela i kamap, na ol disaipel i lukim tupela i toktok wantaim Jisas.
Pita i lukim dispela na em i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let's make three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

block.text: "Tisa, yumi stap hia, em i gutpela. Mipela i ken wokim tripela haus win, wanpela bilong yu na wanpela bilong Moses na wanpela bilong Elaija."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he didn't know what to say, for they were very afraid.

block.text: Pita i tok olsem, long wanem, ol i pret tru, na Pita em i no save, bai em i mekim wanem tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A cloud came, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud,

block.text: Orait wanpela klaut i kamap na i karamapim ol. Na wanpela maus insait long dispela klaut i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him.”

block.text: "Dispela em i Pikinini bilong mi, mi laikim em tumas. Yupela harim tok bilong em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

block.text: Na wantu tasol ol disaipel i lukluk nabaut, na ol i no lukim narapela man. Jisas wanpela tasol i stap wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were coming down from the mountain, he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Orait ol i lusim maunten na i wokabaut i go daun, na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what you have seen until after the Son of Man has risen from the dead.”

block.text: "Dispela samting yupela i bin lukim, yupela i no ken tokim wanpela man long en, i go inap long taim Pikinini Bilong Man bai i lusim matmat na i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They kept this saying to themselves, and asked each other:

block.text: Na ol i holimpas dispela tok, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does ‘Rising from the dead’ mean?”

block.text: "Dispela tok bilong lusim matmat na kirap bek, em wanem samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him, saying,

block.text: Na ol i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”

block.text: "Bilong wanem ol saveman bilong lo i save tok long Elaija i mas i kam pastaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah indeed comes first, and restores all things. How is it written about the Son of Man, that he should suffer many things and be despised?

block.text: "Dispela tok em i tru. Elaija em i mas kam pastaim na stretim bek olgeta samting. Tasol olsem wanem long dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God, em i tok long Pikinini Bilong Man i mas karim planti pen, na bai ol man i rabisim em?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they have also done to him whatever they wanted to, even as it is written about him.”

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela olsem, Elaija em i kam pinis. Na ol man i bin bihainim laik bilong ol yet na ol i bin mekim ol kain kain pasin long em, olsem tok i stap long buk bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

block.text: Jisas wantaim tripela disaipel i go kamap long ol arapela disaipel, na ol i lukim bikpela lain manmeri i raunim ol i stap. Na sampela saveman bilong lo ol i pait long toktok wantaim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.
He asked the scribes,

block.text: Dispela olgeta manmeri ol i lukim Jisas i kam, na kwiktaim ol i kirap nogut. Ol i ran i go long em, na ol i givim gude long em.
Na Jisas i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you asking them?”

block.text: "Yupela i pait long toktok wantaim ol long wanem samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the multitude answered,

block.text: Na wanpela man namel long dispela lain manmeri em i bekim tok bilong Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I brought to you my son, who has a mute spirit.

block.text: "Tisa, pikinini man bilong mi em i gat wanpela spirit mauspas i stap long em, na mi bringim em i kam long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth, and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”

block.text: Planti taim dispela spirit i save holim em strong, na i save tromoi em i go daun long graun. Na waitpela spet i save kamap long maus bilong en, na em i save kaikaim tit, na bodi bilong en i save tait olgeta. Na mi askim ol disaipel bilong yu long rausim dispela spirit nogut, tasol ol i no inap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered him,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok, na em I tokim ol manmeri olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to me.”

block.text: "Yupela lain manmeri i no bilip, hamas taim mi stap yet wantaim yupela? Hamas taim moa bai mi karim hevi bilong yupela? Bringim dispela pikinini i kam long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

block.text: Na ol i bringim dispela pikinini i kam long em. Dispela spirit i lukim Jisas, na kwiktaim em i sakim pikinini nogut tru, na pikinini i pundaun long graun, na i tantanim, na waitpela spet i kamap long maus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked the boy's father,

block.text: Na Jisas i askim papa bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How long has it been since this has come to him?”

block.text: "Hamas taim em i stap olsem?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na papa i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “From childhood.
Often it has cast him both into the fire and into the water, to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us, and help us.”

block.text: "Stat long taim em i liklik yet.
Planti taim dispela spirit nogut i save tromoim em i go daun long paia na long wara, na i laik kilim em i dai. Tasol sapos yu inap, orait yu ken sori long mipela na helpim mipela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yu tok, 'sapos yu inap'? Sapos yu bilip, yu inap long mekim olgeta samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately the father of the child cried out with tears,

block.text: Na kwiktaim papa bilong dispela pikinini i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I believe. Help my unbelief!”

block.text: "Mi bilip, tasol bilip bilong mi i sot. Yu mas helpim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw that a multitude came running together, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him,

block.text: Jisas i lukim ol bikpela lain manmeri i ran i kam klostu long ol. Olsem na em i krosim dispela spirit nogut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him, and never enter him again!”

block.text: "Yu spirit mauspas na yaupas, mi tokim yu, yu mas lusim dispela pikinini. Na yu no ken i go insait long em gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having cried out,
and convulsed greatly, it came out of him. The boy became like one dead; so much that most of them said,

block.text: Na dispela spirit i singaut nogut,
na em i sakim pikinini moa yet, na em i lusim em na i go. Na pikinini i stap olsem em i dai pinis. Na planti man i lukim na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is dead.”

block.text: "Em i dai pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus took him by the hand, and raised him up; and he arose.

block.text: Tasol Jisas i holim han bilong en na i kirapim em, na em i sanap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the house, his disciples asked him privately,

block.text: Bihain Jisas i go long haus, na ol disaipel tasol I stap na ol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why couldn't we cast it out?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na mipela i no inap long rausim dispela spirit nogut?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This kind can come out by nothing, except by prayer and fasting.”

block.text: "Pasin bilong prea tasol em inap long rausim dispela kain spirit. I no gat narapela rot."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went out from there, and passed through Galilee. He didn't want anyone to know it.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i lusim dispela ples na ol I wokabaut i go namel long distrik Galili. Na Jisas i no laik long wanpela man i ken save olsem em i stap,

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he was teaching his disciples, and said to them,

block.text: long wanem, em i wok long skulim ol disaipel bilong en. Em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man is being handed over to the hands of men, and they will kill him; and when he is killed, on the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: "Ol bai i putim Pikinini Bilong Man long han bilong ol man, na ol bai i kilim em i dai. Ol i kilim em i dai pinis, orait long de namba 3 bai em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn't understand the saying, and were afraid to ask him.

block.text: Tasol ol i no save long as bilong dispela tok. Na ol i pret long askim em long tokim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to Capernaum, and when he was in the house he asked them,

block.text: Orait Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i kamap long taun Kaperneam. Ol i go insait long haus pinis, na Jisas i askim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What were you arguing among yourselves on the way?”

block.text: "Long rot yupela i mekim wanem toktok?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent, for they had disputed one with another on the way about who was the greatest.

block.text: Tasol ol i no gat tok. Long wanem, long rot ol i bin tok pait long husat em I namba wan bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sat down, and called the twelve; and he said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i sindaun, na i singautim ol 12 -pela disaipel i kam. Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If any man wants to be first, he shall be last of all, and servant of all.”

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man I laik i stap namba wan, orait em i mas i stap las tru, olsem wokman bilong helpim olgeta man."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took a little child, and set him in their midst. Taking him in his arms, he said to them,

block.text: Na em i kisim wanpela liklik pikinini na i sanapim em namel long ol. Na Jisas i holim pikinini na i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives one such little child in my name, receives me, and whoever receives me, doesn't receive me, but him who sent me.”

block.text: "Man i tingting long mi na i helpim wanpela liklik pikinini olsem dispela pikinini, em i helpim mi. Na man i helpim mi, em i no helpim mi tasol. Nogat. Em i helpim Papa, em i bin salim mi na mi kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: John said to him,

block.text: Jon i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we saw someone who doesn't follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn't follow us.”

block.text: "Tisa, mipela i lukim wanpela man i wok long rausim ol spirit nogut long nem bilong yu. Tasol em i no bihainim yumi. Olsem na mipela i tambuim em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't forbid him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name, and be able quickly to speak evil of me.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken tambuim em. Sapos wanpela man i wokim mirakel long nem bilong mi, bai em i no inap tok nogut long mi kwiktaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever is not against us is on our side.

block.text: Man i no birua long yumi, em i pren bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will give you a cup of water to drink in my name, because you are Christ's, most certainly I tell you, he will in no way lose his reward.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i lukim yupela, na em i ting, 'Mi laik helpim ol dispela man bilong lain bilong Krais,' na em i givim kap wara long yupela, orait mi tok tru long yupela, pe bilong dispela man bai i no inap lus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever will cause one of these little ones who believe in me to stumble, it would be better for him if he were thrown into the sea with a millstone hung around his neck.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos wanpela man i mekim wanpela bilong ol dispela liklik pikinini i bilip long mi i pundaun long sin, orait mobeta ol man i pasim wanpela bikpela ston long nek bilong dispela man, na tromoi em i go daun long solwara na bai em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having your two hands to go into Gehenna, into the unquenchable fire,

block.text: Sapos han bilong yu em i pulim yu long mekim sin, orait yu mas katim na rausim. Mobeta yu gat wanpela han tasol na yu kisim laip bilong i stap oltaim. Nogut yu gat tupela han na ol i tromoi yu i go long hel, long paia i no save dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: 'long dispela ples 'ol liklik snek i wok long kaikai bodi bilong ol, ol bai i no inap pinis. Na paia i wok long kukim bodi bilong ol, em tu bai i no inap pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life lame, rather than having your two feet to be cast into Gehenna, into the fire that will never be quenched--

block.text: Na sapos lek bilong yu em i pulim yu long mekim sin, orait yu mas katim na rausim. Mobeta yu gat wanpela lek tasol na yu kisim laip bilong i stap oltaim. Nogut yu gat tupela lek na ol i tromoi yu i go long hel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: 'long dispela ples 'ol liklik snek i wok long kaikai bodi bilong ol, ol bai i no inap pinis. Na paia i wok long kukim bodi bilong ol, em tu bai i no inap pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your eye causes you to sin, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

block.text: Na sapos ai bilong yu em i pulim yu long mekim sin, orait yu mas kamautim na tromoi i go. Mobeta yu gat wanpela ai tasol na yu go insait long kingdom bilong God. Nogut yu gat tupela ai na ol i tromoi yu i go long hel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.’

block.text: Long dispela ples 'ol liklik snek i wok long kaikai bodi bilong ol, ol bai i no inap pinis. Na paia i wok long kukim bodi bilong ol, em tu bai i no inap pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone will be salted with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.

block.text: "Ol i save putim sol long olgeta ofa, bilong mekim ol i kamap klin long ai bilong God. Olsem tasol, paia i mas kamap long olgeta man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salt is good, but if the salt has lost its saltiness, with what will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

block.text: "Sol em i gutpela samting. Tasol sapos pait bilong sol em i lus pinis, bai yupela inap mekim wanem na dispela sol i gat pait gen? Sol i save mekim ol abus samting i stap gut, olsem tasol yupela i mas kamap olsem gutpela sol i kamapim gutpela sindaun namel long ol brata."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 10
He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.

block.text: Jisas i kirap na i lusim dispela hap, na em i go long hap bilong distrik Judia na long hapsait bilong wara Jordan. Na planti manmeri ol i kam bung gen long em. Na em i bihainim pasin bilong em, na em i givim tok bilong God long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him,

block.text: Na ol Farisi i kam long Jisas, na ol i laik traim em. Ol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”

block.text: "Lo bilong yumi em I orait long man i ken rausim meri bilong en, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did Moses command you?”

block.text: "Moses i givim wanem lo long yupela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”

block.text: "Moses em i orait long man i ken raitim pepa bilong katim marit na givim long meri na rausim em i go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.

block.text: "Yupela i man bilong bikhet, olsem na Moses i raitim dispela lo na i givim long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.

block.text: Harim. 'Bipo tru, taim God i wokim olgeta samting, em i wokim ol manmeri na em i mekim ol i kamap man na meri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,

block.text: Olsem na man i save lusim papamama na i pas wantaim meri bilong en,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.

block.text: na tupela i kamap wanpela bodi tasol.' God i tok olsem na tupela i no i stap olsem tupela moa. Nogat. Tupela i kamap olsem wanpela bodi tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”

block.text: Olsem na samting God i pasim pinis, em man i no ken katim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.
He said to them,

block.text: Bihain Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i go bek long haus, na ol disaipel i askim em gen long dispela tok bilong katim marit.
Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i lusim meri bilong en na i maritim narapela meri, dispela man i rongim meri bilong en na i mekim pasin pamuk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.”

block.text: Na sapos wanpela meri i lusim man bilong en na i maritim narapela man, dispela meri em i mekim pasin pamuk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were bringing to him little children so that he would touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them, saying:

block.text: Ol manmeri i bringim ol liklik pikinini i kam long Jisas. Ol i laik bai em i putim han long ol. Tasol ol disaipel i lukim,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't bother the teacher!”

block.text: na ol I krosim ol dispela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them,

block.text: Jisas i lukim dispela, na em i bel nogut. Em i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me! Don't forbid them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: "Yupela larim ol pikinini i kam long mi. Yupela i no ken pasim ol. Nogat. Kingdom bilong God em i bilong kain man olsem ol dispela pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, sapos wanpela man i no kisim kingdom bilong God olsem ol liklik pikinini i save kisim, em i no inap i go insait long en. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.

block.text: Na em i holim ol pikinini long han bilong en, na i putim han antap long ol, na em i askim God long mekim gut long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him,

block.text: Jisas i kirap na i wokabaut i go, na wanpela man i ran i kam, na i brukim skru long em, na i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”

block.text: "Gutpela Tisa, bai mi mekim wanem na mi ken kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one--God.

block.text: "Bilong wanem yu kolim mi gutpela? God wanpela tasol em i gutpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’”

block.text: Yu save pinis long ol tok bilong lo. 'Yupela i no ken kilim i dai ol arapela manmeri. Yupela ol marit, yupela i no ken mekim pasin pamuk. Yupela i no ken stil. Yupela i no ken giaman na kotim nating ol arapela manmeri. Yupela i no ken paulim na pulim ol samting bilong ol arapela man. Yupela i mas aninit long papamama bilong yupela na bihainim tok bilong ol.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Na dispela man i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”

block.text: "Tisa, taim mi pikinini yet na i kam inap long nau, mi save bihainim olgeta dispela lo."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him,

block.text: Jisas i lukluk long em na i laikim em tumas. Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”

block.text: "Yu sot yet long wanpela samting. Yu go salim ol samting bilong yu, na dispela mani yu kisim yu mas givim long ol rabisman. Yu mekim olsem, na bai yu gat ol gutpela samting tru long heven. Na yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.

block.text: Dispela man i harim dispela tok, na pes bilong en i kamap nogut, na bel bilong en i hevi, na em i go. Long wanem, em i gat planti samting tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk long ol disaipel bilong en na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!”

block.text: "Ol man i gat planti samting ol bai i hatwok tru long i go insait long kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again,

block.text: Na ol disaipel i kirap nogut long dispela tok bilong em. Tasol Jisas i tokim ol moa olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, how hard is it for those who trust in riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: "Ol pikinini, man i laik i go insait long kingdom bilong God, em i gat hatwok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Kamel i laik i go insait long hul bilong nil bilong samap, em i no gat hatwok olsem maniman i laik i go insait long kingdom bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him,

block.text: Orait ol disaipel i kirap nogut tru, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: "Sapos i olsem, orait husat inap kisim laip i stap gut oltaim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, looking at them, said,

block.text: Na Jisas i lukluk stret long ol na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”

block.text: "Ol man yet ol i no inap, tasol God em inap. God em inap mekim olgeta samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter began to tell him,

block.text: Na Pita I mekim wanpela tok long Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.”

block.text: "Lukim. Mipela i bin lusim olgeta samting na i bihainim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela, olgeta man i bin ting long mi na long gutnius na i lusim haus o brata o susa o mama o papa o pikinini o gaden,

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time, houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.

block.text: bai ol i kisim 100 moa. Taim ol i stap yet long dispela graun God bai i givim ol planti samting tru, i winim ol samting ol i bin i gat bipo. Ol bai i kisim planti haus na planti brata na planti susa na planti mama na planti pikinini na planti gaden. Na tu, bai sampela man i mekim pasin nogut long ol. Na long taim i laik kamap bihain ol bai i kisim laip i stap gut oltaim oltaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”

block.text: Tasol planti man nau ol i stap namba wan, ol bai i stap las tru. Na planti man nau ol i stap las, ol bai i stap namba wan."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him, saying:

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i wokabaut long rot na ol i laik i go long Jerusalem. Jisas i go paslain long ol. Na ol disaipel ol i tingting planti. Na ol manmeri i bihainim ol, ol i pret. Jisas i kisim ol 12 -pela disaipel gen, na em i stat long tokim ol long ol samting i laik kamap long em.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.

block.text: "Harim. Nau yumi go long Jerusalem, na ol bai i givim Pikinini Bilong Man long han bilong ol bikpris na ol saveman bilong lo. Na bai ol i mekim kot long em na pasim tok long kilim em i dai. Na bai ol i givim em long ol man bilong ol arapela lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”

block.text: Na ol dispela man bai i tok bilas long em na spetim em na wipim em na kilim em i dai. Na long de namba 3 bai em i kirap bek."

ReferenceBlocks.text: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying,

block.text: Orait Jems na Jon, tupela pikinini bilong Sebedi, tupela i kam long Jisas na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”

block.text: "Tisa, mitupela i laik askim yu long wanpela samting, na mitupela i laik bai yu mas mekim dispela samting long mitupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: "Yutupela i laik bai mi mekim wanem samting long yutupela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Tupela i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”

block.text: "Taim yu kamap bikpela king pinis, mitupela i laik bai wanpela long mitupela i ken sindaun long han sut bilong yu, na wanpela long han kais."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don't know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”

block.text: "Yutupela i no save gut long dispela samting yutupela i askim mi long en. Ating yutupela inap dring long dispela kap nau mi laik dring long en? Ating yutupela inap long kisim dispela baptais nau mi laik kisim?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na tupela i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are able.”

block.text: "Mitupela inap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Jisas i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with.

block.text: "Tru, dispela kap nau mi laik dring long en, em bai yutupela tu i dring long en. Na dispela baptais nau mi laik kisim, em bai yutupela tu i kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”

block.text: Tasol husat bai i sindaun long han sut na long han kais bilong mi, dispela em i no samting bilong mi long makim. Nogat. Dispela ol sia ol i bilong ol man God i redim pinis bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

block.text: Taim ol 10 -pela disaipel i harim tok long samting Jems na Jon i bin askim Jisas, ol i kros long tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, and said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i singautim ol i kam long em, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.

block.text: "Yupela i save, ol man i save stap olsem ol hetman bilong ol arapela lain manmeri, ol i save bosim tru ol lain bilong ol. Na ol bikman bilong ol i save strong tumas long ol manmeri i mas bihainim tok bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.

block.text: Tasol dispela pasin i no ken i stap namel long yupela. Nogat. Man i laik i stap bikman namel long yupela, em i mas i stap wokman bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.

block.text: Na man i laik i stap namba wan bilong yupela, em i mas i stap olsem wokboi nating bilong olgeta man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

block.text: Long wanem, Pikinini Bilong Man tu em i no i kam bilong ol man i ken mekim wok bilong helpim em. Nogat. Em i kam bilong helpim ol, na bilong givim laip bilong em yet bilong baim bek planti manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel ol i kamap long taun Jeriko. Na Jisas i lusim Jeriko na i go. Na ol disaipel bilong en, wantaim bikpela lain manmeri, ol i go wantaim em. Na Bartimeus, pikinini bilong Timeus, em i sindaun i stap arere long rot. Em i aipas, na em i save askim ol manmeri long mani samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say,

block.text: Em i harim tok long Jisas bilong Nasaret i kam, na em i stat long singaut strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: "Jisas, yu Pikinini Bilong Devit, yu mas sori long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many rebuked him, saying:

block.text: Planti man ol I krosim em na tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Yu pasim maus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out even more,

block.text: Tasol em i singaut bikmaus moa yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: "Pikinini Bilong Devit, yu mas sori long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stood still, and said,

block.text: Na Jisas i sanap na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Call him.”

block.text: "Singautim em i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They called the blind man, saying to him,

block.text: Na ol I singautim dispela aipas, Na ol I singautim dispela aipas, na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”

block.text: "Bel bilong yu i ken strong. Yu kirap. Em i singautim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: Orait em i tromoi saket bilong en, na i sanap kwiktaim, na i go long Jisas.
Na Jisas I askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do for you?”

block.text: "Yu laik bai mi mekim wanem long yu?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The blind man said to him,

block.text: Na dispela aipas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, that I may see again.”

block.text: "Tisa, mi laik lukluk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.”

block.text: "Yu ken i go. Bilip bilong yu i bin mekim yu i orait."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

block.text: Na wantu tasol ai bilong en i orait na em i lukluk. Na em i bihainim Jisas i go long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 11
When they drew near to Jerusalem, to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, he sent two of his disciples,
and said to them,

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel bilong en i kamap klostu long Jerusalem, na ol i kamap long ples Betfage na Betani, long maunten Oliv. Na Jisas i salim tupela disaipel
na i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village that is opposite you. Immediately as you enter into it, you will find a young donkey tied, on which no one has sat. Untie him, and bring him.

block.text: "Yutupela go long dispela ples nau yumi lukluk long en. Yutupela go long dispela ples, na wantu bai yutupela i lukim wanpela yangpela donki ol i pasim i stap. I no gat wanpela man i bin sindaun long en bipo. Lusim rop na bringim donki i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord needs him;’ and immediately he will send him back here.”

block.text: Na sapos wanpela man i askim yutupela, 'Bilong wanem yutupela i kisim donki i go?', orait yutupela i mas bekim tok olsem, 'Bikpela i gat wok long en, na em bai i salim i kam bek kwiktaim.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went away, and found a young donkey tied at the door outside in the open street, and they untied him.

block.text: Orait tupela i go, na tupela i lukim wanpela yangpela donki i sanap i stap long rot. Ol man i bin pasim dispela donki i stap klostu long dua bilong wanpela haus. Orait tupela i lusim rop long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of those who stood there asked them,

block.text: Na ol man i sanap klostu ol i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you doing, untying the young donkey?”

block.text: "Yutupela i laik mekim wanem na yutupela i lusim dispela donki?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to them:

block.text: Na tupela i bekim tok olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs him.”

block.text: Jisas i bin tokim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people told them:

block.text: Na ol i orait long tupela

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You may go.”

block.text: i ken kisim donki i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought the young donkey to Jesus, and threw their garments on it, and Jesus sat on it.

block.text: Orait tupela i bringim donki i kam long Jisas. Na tupela i putim longpela klos bilong tupela antap long en, na Jisas i sindaun long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many spread their garments on the way, and others were cutting down branches from the trees, and spreading them on the road.

block.text: Na planti man i rausim longpela klos bilong ol na lainim long rot. Na sampela i go long gaden na katim ol han bilong diwai na putim long rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who went in front, and those who followed, cried out,

block.text: Na ol manmeri i wokabaut i go paslain long Jisas wantaim ol manmeri i wokabaut i kam bihain, olgeta i wok long singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

block.text: "Amamas long God. God i ken mekim gut long dispela man i kam long nem bilong Bikpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David that is coming in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

block.text: God i ken mekim gut long dispela king i laik bosim yumi nau, em king i kam long lain bilong tumbuna bilong yumi, Devit. Litimapim nem bilong God Antap Tru!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus entered into the temple in Jerusalem. When he had looked around at everything, it being now evening, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

block.text: Na Jisas i kamap long Jerusalem, na em i go insait long banis bilong tempel, na i lukluk raun long olgeta samting. Tasol nau san i laik i go daun, olsem na em i go bek long Betani wantaim ol 12 -pela disaipel bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The next day, when they had come out from Bethany, he was hungry.

block.text: Long de bihain ol i lusim Betani na i kam yet, na Jisas em i hangre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came to see if perhaps he might find anything on it. When he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
Jesus told it,

block.text: Em i lukim wanpela diwai fik i sanap longwe liklik na i gat planti lip. Orait em i go klostu long diwai bilong painim sampela kaikai, tasol em i no lukim wanpela kaikai i stap long en. Nogat. Ol lip tasol i stap, long wanem, em i no taim bilong ol diwai fik i karim kaikai.
Na Jisas i tokim dispela diwai olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!”

block.text: "Yu no ken karim kaikai moa na ol man i kaikai. Nogat tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and his disciples heard it.

block.text: Na ol disaipel bilong en ol i harim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to Jerusalem, and Jesus entered into the temple, and began to throw out those who sold and those who bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money changers, and the seats of those who sold the doves.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i go kamap long Jerusalem. Na Jisas i go insait long banis bilong tempel na i stat long rausim ol man i mekim wok bisnis i stap long dispela hap. Em i kapsaitim ol tebol bilong ol man i wok long senisim mani, wantaim ol sia bilong ol man i wok long salim ol pisin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He would not allow anyone to carry a container through the temple.

block.text: Na em i tambuim ol long ol i no ken karim ol samting na wokabaut i go i kam insait long banis bilong tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught, saying to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't it written, ‘My house will be called a house of prayer for all the nations?’ But you have made it a den of robbers!”

block.text: "Buk bilong God i gat tok olsem, 'Haus bilong mi bai i stap haus bilong ol manmeri bilong olgeta kantri i ken i kam long en na beten long mi.' Tasol yupela i mekim em i kamap olsem ples hait bilong ol stilman."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him. For they feared him, because all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Ol bikpris wantaim ol saveman bilong lo ol i harim dispela tok, na ol i stat long painim rot bilong kilim Jisas i dai. Ol i mekim olsem, long wanem, ol i pret long em. Long wanem, olgeta manmeri i save kirap nogut tru long tok em i save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, he went out of the city.

block.text: Na long apinun Jisas wantaim ol disaipel ol i lusim Jerusalem na i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.

block.text: Long de bihain long moningtaim tru Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i wokabaut i go, na ol i lukim dispela diwai fik i drai pinis. Ol lip wantaim rop bilong en olgeta i drai pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter, remembering, said to him,

block.text: Na Pita i tingim dispela samting Jisas i bin mekim, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which you cursed has withered away.”

block.text: "Tisa, lukim. Asde yu tok long dispela diwai fik i mas bagarap. Na nau em i drai pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have faith in God.

For most certainly I tell you, whoever may tell this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and doesn't doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is happening; he shall have whatever he says.

block.text: "Yupela i mas bilip long God.

Wanpela man inap tokim dispela maunten olsem, 'Yu kirap na yu kalap i go daun long solwara.' Sapos dispela man i no gat tupela bel, tasol em i bilip tru long dispela samting bai i kamap olsem em i tok, orait mi tok tru long yupela, dispela samting bai i kamap olsem em i tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, all things whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received them, and you shall have them.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i mekim prea na i beten long kisim wanpela samting, na sapos yupela i bilip tru olsem, yupela bai i kisim dispela samting, orait mi tokim yupela, dispela samting bai i kamap olsem yupela i tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive them so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your transgressions.

block.text: Whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive them so that your Father who is in heaven may also forgive you your transgressions.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”

block.text: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your transgressions.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came again to Jerusalem, and as he was walking in the temple, the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders came to him,
and they began saying to him,

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i kamap gen long Jerusalem. Na Jisas i wokabaut insait long banis bilong tempel, na ol bikpris wantaim ol saveman bilong lo na ol hetman ol i kam long em.
Ol i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By what authority do you do these things? Or who gave you this authority to do these things?”

block.text: "Yu kisim dispela namba na strong we na yu mekim ol dispela samting? Husat i givim dispela namba long yu na i tokim yu long mekim dispela wok?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

block.text: "Mi tu mi laik askim yupela long wanpela samting. Na sapos yupela i bekim stret askim bilong mi, orait bai mi tokim yupela long husat i givim mi namba bilong mekim ol dispela wok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The baptism of John--was it from heaven, or from men? Answer me.”

block.text: Taim Jon i baptaisim ol man, yupela i ting em i samting bilong heven, o em i samting bilong ol man tasol? Yupela bekim tok long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Orait ol i toktok long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we should say, ‘From heaven’; he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

block.text: "Sapos yumi tok, 'Em i samting bilong heven,' em bai i tok, 'Orait bilong wanem yupela i no bin bilip long em?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If we should say, ‘From men’”

block.text: Tasol sapos yumi tok, 'Em i samting bilong man tasol,' bai dispela tok tu i no inap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: --they feared the people because they believed that John really was a prophet.
They answered Jesus,

block.text: Ol i tok olsem, long wanem, ol i pret long ol manmeri. Olgeta manmeri i ting Jon em i profet tru.
Olsem na ol i bekim tok bilong Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don't know.”

block.text: "Mipela i no save."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither do I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: "Mi tu mi no ken tokim yupela long husat i givim mi namba na mi mekim dispela wok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MARK CHP 12
He began to speak to them in parables.

block.text: Jisas i mekim sampela tok piksa long ol bikman bilong ol Juda. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, put a hedge around it, dug a pit for the winepress, built a tower, rented it out to a farmer, and went into another country.

block.text: "Wanpela man i bin wokim wanpela gaden wain, na i banisim. Na em i wokim hul olsem tang bilong krungutim na memeim ol pikinini wain, na em i wokim haus bilong ol man i ken i stap na was long gaden. Na em i putim dispela gaden long han bilong sampela man i laik wok bisnis long en. Na em yet i go long wanpela longwe ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was time, he sent a servant to the farmer to get from the farmer his share of the fruit of the vineyard.

block.text: Orait long taim bilong ol diwai wain i karim kaikai, em i salim wanpela wokboi i go long ol man i wok long gaden wain. Em i laik bai ol i givim em sampela kaikai bilong dispela gaden.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Tasol ol man i wok long gaden ol i holimpas dispela wokboi na paitim em nogut, na ol i rausim em i go nating.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

block.text: Na papa bilong gaden i salim narapela wokboi i go long ol. Na ol i brukim het bilong en na mekim nogut long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he sent another; and they killed him; and many others, beating some, and killing some.

block.text: Na em i salim wanpela wokboi moa. Na ol i kilim dispela wokboi i dai. Na bihain em i salim planti wokboi moa i go long ol. Na ol i paitim sampela, na ol i kilim sampela i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore still having one, his beloved son, he sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

block.text: Na wanpela man moa tasol i stap. Dispela man em pikinini bilong en, em i laikim tumas. Tasol las tru em i salim dispela pikinini i go long ol man i wok long gaden. Papa i tok olsem, 'Bai ol i harim tok bilong pikinini bilong mi.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those farmers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

block.text: Tasol ol dispela man i wok long gaden ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem, 'Dispela man hia bai i kisim olgeta samting bilong papa bilong en. Goan, yumi kilim em i dai, na bai yumi yet i holim dispela gaden.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: They took him, killed him, and cast him out of the vineyard.

block.text: Olsem na ol i kisim em na kilim em i dai. Na ol i tromoi bodi bilong en i go ausait long gaden.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.

block.text: "Orait papa bilong gaden wain bai em i mekim wanem? Harim. Em bai i kam na kilim i dai ol dispela man i wok long gaden. Na em bai i givim dispela gaden wain long ol arapela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Haven't you even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner.

block.text: "Ating yupela i no bin ritim dispela hap tok i stap long buk bilong God, a? Dispela tok i olsem, 'Dispela ston ol kamda i ting em i nogut na ol i rausim, nau em i kamap nambawan ston bilong strongim banis bilong haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was from the Lord, it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

block.text: Bikpela yet i mekim dispela samting i kamap, na mipela i lukim em i gutpela tru.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They tried to seize him, but they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spoke the parable against them. They left him, and went away.

block.text: Ol bikman i save, Jisas i laik sutim tok long ol tasol na em i mekim dispela tok piksa. Ol i laik tru long holimpas Jisas, tasol ol i pret long ol manmeri. Olsem na ol i lusim em na ol i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They sent some of the Pharisees and of the Herodians to him, that they might trap him with words.

block.text: Ol bikman i salim sampela Farisi wantaim sampela man bilong lain bilong Herot i go long Jisas. Ol i laik trikim Jisas long mekim sampela tok i no stret, bai ol i ken kotim em long tok bilong em yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had come, they asked him,

block.text: Orait ol i kam na ol i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you are honest, and don't defer to anyone; for you aren't partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
Shall we give, or shall we not give?”

block.text: "Tisa, mipela i save, yu man bilong tok tru. Na yu no save pret long wanpela man. Yu save mekim wankain tok long olgeta man, maski ol i gat nem o ol i no gat nem. Long tok tru tasol yu save skulim ol manmeri long pasin bilong God. Orait, yu ting wanem? I orait long yumi ken givim takis long Sisar, o nogat? Yumi mas givim, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save pinis long giaman bilong ol, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius, that I may see it.”

block.text: "Watpo yupela i traim mi? Kisim wanpela mani i kam na mi lukim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it. He said to them,

block.text: Na ol i kisim wanpela mani i kam. Na em i askim ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whose is this image and inscription?”

block.text: "Dispela piksa na dispela nem em i bilong husat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar's.”

block.text: "Bilong Sisar."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

block.text: "Orait samting bilong Sisar, em yupela i mas givim long Sisar. Na samting bilong God, em yupela i mas givim long God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They marveled greatly at him.

block.text: Ol i harim tok bilong en na ol i kirap nogut tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There came to him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection. They asked him, saying,

block.text: Orait nau ol Sadyusi i kam long Jisas. Ol dispela lain i save tok, ol man i dai pinis, bai ol i no inap kirap bek. Orait ol i askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us, ‘If a man's brother dies, and leaves a wife behind him, and leaves no children, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up offspring for his brother.’

block.text: "Tisa, Moses i bin raitim wanpela tok bilong yumi olsem. Sapos wanpela man i dai, na em i no gat pikinini, tasol meri bilong en i stap yet, orait brata bilong dispela man i mas maritim dispela meri na kamapim ol pikinini, bai lain bilong brata bilong en i no ken pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

block.text: Orait wanpela taim 7 -pela brata i stap. Namba wan em i kisim meri, na bihain em i dai, na i no gat pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her, and died, leaving no children behind him. The third likewise;

block.text: Olsem na namba 2 brata i kisim dispela meri. Na em tu i dai, na i no gat pikinini. Na namba 3 brata em tu i mekim wankain pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and the seven took her and left no children. Last of all the woman also died.

block.text: Olsem tasol dispela 7 -pela brata olgeta ol i maritim dispela meri, na ol i no gat pikinini, na ol i dai. Na bihain tru, meri tu em i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be of them? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Orait bihain, taim ol man i dai pinis ol i kirap bek, dispela meri bai i stap meri bilong husat tru? Yu save, ol 7 -pela man i bin kisim em na em i stap meri bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Isn't this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

block.text: "Yupela i no save long ol tok i stap long buk bilong God. Na yupela i no save long strong bilong God tu. Olsem na yupela i mekim tok kranki.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when they will rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.

block.text: Long taim ol man i dai pinis, ol i lusim matmat na i kirap bek, ol dispela lain manmeri bai ol i no inap marit. Nogat. Bai ol i stap olsem ol ensel bilong heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But about the dead, that they are raised; haven't you read in the book of Moses, about the Bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?

block.text: "Tasol long dispela tok bilong ol man i dai pinis na i kirap bek, ating yupela i no bin ritim long buk bilong Moses dispela stori bilong liklik diwai i paia? Long dispela stori God i tokim Moses olsem, 'Mi God bilong Abraham na bilong Aisak na bilong Jekop.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are therefore badly mistaken.”

block.text: God em i no God bilong ol man i dai pinis. Nogat. Em i God bilong ol man i stap laip. Olsem na tok bilong yupela i kranki tru!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together. Knowing that he had answered them well, asked him,

block.text: Wanpela saveman bilong lo i kam, na em i harim ol Sadyusi i pait long toktok wantaim Jisas. Na em i harim Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol gutpela tru. Olsem na em i askim Jisas,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which commandment is the greatest of all?”

block.text: "Wanem lo em i winim olgeta lo na i namba wan?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jisas i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The greatest is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one:

block.text: "Namba wan lo em i dispela, 'Yupela Israel, harim gut. Bikpela em wanpela tasol em i God bilong yumi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.

block.text: Yupela i mas laikim God, Bikpela bilong yumi. Yupela i mas laikim em tru long bel bilong yupela na long spirit bilong yupela na long tingting bilong yupela na long strong bilong yupela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second is like this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

block.text: Na namba 2 lo em i dispela, 'Yu mas laikim ol wantok olsem yu laikim yu yet.' I no gat narapela lo i bikpela na i winim dispela tupela lo."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The scribe said to him,

block.text: Orait dispela saveman bilong lo i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly, teacher, you have said well that he is one, and there is none other but he.

block.text: "Tisa, tok bilong yu i gutpela. I tru, Bikpela wanpela tasol em i God, na i no gat narapela God i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is more important than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

block.text: Yumi mas laikim em tru long bel bilong yumi na long save bilong yumi na long strong bilong yumi. Na yumi mas laikim ol wantok olsem yumi save laikim yumi yet.
